summary.para: The delegate for the FieldSelecting event.

member.param: Required. The cache object that raised the event.
Required. The instance of the PXFieldSelectingEventArgs type that holds data for the FieldSelecting event.

remarks.para: The FieldSelecting event is generated in the following cases:

list.item: When the external representationthe way the value should be displayed in the UIof a data access class field (DAC) value is requested from the UI or through the Web Service API.

When any of the following methods of the PXCache class initiates the assigning the default value to a field:
Insert()
Insert(object)
Insert(IDictionary)

While a field is updated in the PXCache object, and this action is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Update(object)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)

While a DAC field value is requested through any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
GetValueInt(object, string)
GetValueIntField(object)
GetValueExt(object, string)
GetValueExt<Field>(object)
GetValuePending(object, string)
ToDictionary(object)
GetStateExt(object, string)
GetStateExt<Field>(object)

remarks.para: The FieldSelecting event handler is used to perform the following actions:

list.item: Conversion of the internal presentation of a DAC field (the data field value of a DAC instance) to the external presentation (the value displayed in the UI)
Conversion of the values of multiple DAC fields to a single external presentation
Provision of additional information to set up a DAC field input control or cell presentation

remarks.para: The following execution order is used for the FieldSelecting event handlers:

list.item: Graph event handlers are executed.
If e.Cancel is false, attribute event handlers are executed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXFieldUpdating

summary.para: The delegate for the FieldUpdating event.

member.param: Required. The cache object that raised the event.
Required. The instance of the PXFieldUpdatingEventArgs type that holds data for the FieldUpdating event.

remarks.para: In the following cases, the FieldUpdating event is generated for a data access class (DAC) field before the field is updated:

list.item: For each DAC field value that is received from the UI or through the Web Service API when a data record is being inserted or updated.
For each DAC key field value in the process of deleting a data record when the deletion is initiated from the UI or through the Web Service API.

When any of the following methods of the PXCache class initiates the assigning of the default value to a field:
Insert()
Insert(object)
Insert(IDictionary)
SetDefaultExt(object, string)
SetDefaultExt<Field>(object)

When any of the following methods of the PXCache class initiates the updating of a field:
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)
SetValueExt(object, string, object)
SetValueExt<Field>(object, object)
SetValuePending(object, string, object)
SetValuePending<Field>(object, object)

When the conversion of the external DAC key field presentation to the internal field value is initiated by the following PXCache class methods:
Insert()
Insert(object)
Insert(IDictionary)

remarks.para: The FieldUpdating event handler is used when either or both of the following occur:

list.item: The external presentation of a DAC field (the value displayed in the UI) differs from the value stored in the DAC.
The storage of values is spread among multiple DAC fields (database columns).

remarks.para: In both cases, the application should implement both the FieldUpdating and FieldSelecting events.
The following execution order is used for the FieldUpdating event handlers:

list.item: Graph event handlers are executed.
If e.Cancel is false, attribute event handlers are executed.

summary.para: The delegate for the FieldVerifying event.

member.param: Required. The cache object that raised the event.
Required. The instance of the PXFieldVerifyingEventArgs type that holds data for the PXFieldVerifying event.

remarks.para: The system generates the FieldVerifying event for each data access class (DAC) field of a data record that is inserted or updated in the PXCache object in the following processes:

list.item: Insertion or update that is initiated in the UI or through the Web Service API.

Assignment of the default value to the DAC field that is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Insert()
Insert(object)
Insert(IDictionary)
SetDefaultExt(object, string)
SetDefaultExt<Event>(object)

A DAC field update that is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Update(object)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)
SetValueExt(object, string, object)
SetValueExt<Field>(object, object)

Validation of a DAC key field value when the validation is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Locate(IDictionary)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)

remarks.para: The FieldVerifying event handler is used to perform the following actions:

list.item: Implementation of the business logic associated with the validation of the DAC field value before the value is assigned to the DAC field.
Cancellation of the assigning of a value by throwing an exception of the PXSetPropertyException type if the value does not meet the requirements.

Conversion of the external presentation of a DAC field value to the internal presentation and implementation of the associated business logic. The internal presentation is the value stored in a DAC instance.

remarks.para: The following execution order is used for the FieldVerifying event handlers:

list.item: Graph event handlers are executed.
If e.Cancel is false, attribute event handlers are executed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXFieldUpdated

summary.para: The delegate for the FieldUpdated event.

member.param: Required. The cache object that raised the event.
Required. The instance of the PXFieldUpdatedEventArgs type that holds data for the FieldUpdated event.

remarks.para: In the following cases, the FieldUpdated event is generated after a data access class (DAC) field is actually updated:

list.item: For each DAC field value that is received from the UI or through the Web Service API when a data record is inserted or updated in the PXCache object.
For each DAC key field value in the process of deleting a data record from the PXCache object when the deletion is initiated from the UI or through the Web Service API.

When any of the following methods of the PXCache class initiates the assigning of a default value to a field:
Insert()
Insert(object)
Insert(IDictionary)
SetDefaultExt(object, string)
SetDefaultExt<Event>(object)

When the field update is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Update(object)
SetValueExt(object, string, object)
SetValueExt<Field>(object, object)

During the validation of the DAC key field value that is initiated by any of the following PXCache class methods:
Locate(IDictionary)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)
Delete(IDictionary, IDictionary)

remarks.para: The FieldUpdated event handler is used to implement the business logic related to the changes to the value of the DAC field in the following cases:

list.item: To update the related fields of a data record containing a modified field or assigning default values to these fields

To update any of the following:
The detail data records in a one-to-many relationship
The related data records in a one-to-one relationship
The master data records in a many-to-one relationship

remarks.para: The following execution order is used for the FieldUpdated event handlers:

list.item: Attribute event handlers are executed.
Graph event handlers are executed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXExceptionHandling

summary.para: The delegate for the ExceptionHandling event.

member.param: Required. The cache object that raised the event.
Required. The instance of the PXExceptionHandlingEventArgs type that holds data for the ExceptionHandling event.

remarks.para: The ExceptionHandling event is generated in the following cases:

list.item: The PXSetPropertyException exception is thrown while the system is processing a data access class (DAC) field value received from the UI or through the Web Service API when a data record is being inserted or updated in the PXCache object.

The PXSetPropertyException exception is thrown while the system is processing DAC key field values when the deletion of a data record from the PXCache object is initiated in the UI or through the Web Service API.

The PXSetPropertyException exception is thrown when the system is assigning the default value to a field or updating the value when the assignment or update is initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Insert(IDictionary)
SetDefaultExt(object, string)
SetDefaultExt<Field>(object)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)
SetValueExt(object, string, object)
SetValueExt<Field>(object, object

The PXSetPropertyException exception is thrown while the system is converting the external DAC key field presentation to the internal field value initiated by any of the following methods of the PXCache class:
Locate(IDictionary)
Update(IDictionary, IDictionary)
Delete(IDictionary, IDictionary)
The PXCommandPreparingException, PXRowPersistingException, or PXRowPersistedException exception is thrown when an inserted, updated, or deleted data record is saved in the database.

remarks.para: The ExceptionHandling event handler is used to do the following:

list.item: Catch and handle the exceptions mentioned above (the platform rethrows all unhandled exceptions)
Implement non-standard handling of the exceptions mentioned above

remarks.para: The following execution order is used for the ExceptionHandling event handlers:

list.item: Graph event handlers are executed.
If e.Cancel is false, attribute event handlers are executed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCache`1

summary.para: Represents a cache that contains modified data records relating to a particular table along with the controller that allows you to perform basic operations on such records. A type parameter is set to a data access class (DAC) that represents this table.

member.typeparam: The DAC type of data records stored in the cache object.

remarks.para: Cache objects consist of two parts:

list.item: Data records collection that were modified but have not been saved to the database, such as Updated, Inserted, Deleted, and Dirty.
A controller that executes basic data-related operations through the use of the methods, such as Update(), Insert(), Delete(), Persist(), and other methods.

remarks.para: During execution of these methods, the cache object raises events. The graph as well as attributes can subscribe to these events to implement a business logic. Each method is applied to a previously unchanged data record result in placing of the data record into the cache.

The system creates and destroys PXCache instances (caches) on each request. If the user or the code modifies a data record, it is placed into the cache. When request execution is completed, the system serializes the modified records from the caches to the session. At run time, the cache may also include the unchanged data records retrieved during request execution. These data records are discarded once the request is served.

On the next round trip, the modified data records are loaded from the session to the caches. The cache merges the data retrieved from the database with the modified data, and the application accesses the data as if the entire data set has been preserved from the time of previous request.
The cache maintains the modified data until the changes are discarded or saved to the database.
The cache is the issuer of all data-related events, which can be handled by the graph and attributes.

code.title: Example
code.description: An instance of the PXCache<> type. The cache object that initiated the event is passed to every event handler as the first argument.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.HasAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the provided data record has any attributes attached to its fields.
member.param: The data record.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes for the specified field.

param.name: name
param.para: A field name, the attributes of which were returned. The method will return attributes from the entire field collection if null.

member.remarks: The system maintains instances of attributes on three different levels. On its instantiation, a cache object copies appropriate attributes from the global level to the cache level and stores them in an internal collection. When an attribute needs to be modified for a particular data record, the cache creates item-level copies of all attributes and stores them associated with the data record.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes for the specified field.
member.param: The data record.

The value that indicates whether the attributes embedded into an aggregate attribute are included into the list. If true, both the aggregate attribute and the attributes embedded into it are included in the list. Otherwise, only the aggregate attribute is included. An aggregate attribute is an attribute that derives from the PXAggregateAttribute class. This class allows combining multiple different attributes in a single one.
member.remarks: Using this method, you can prevent expanding the aggregate attributes by setting the second parameter to false. Other overloads of this method always include both the aggregate attributes and the attributes that comprise such attributes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current data record. This property points to the last data record displayed in the user interface. If the user selects a data record in a grid, this property points to this data record. If the user or the application inserts, updates, or deletes a data record, the property points to this data record. Assigning this property raises the RowSelected event.
member.remarks: You can reference the Current data record and its fields in the PXSelect BQL statements by using the Current parameter.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.#ctor(PX.Data.PXGraph)
member.summary: The application does not need to instantiate PXCache directly, as the system creates caches automatically whenever they are needed. A cache instance is always bound to an instance of the business logic controller (graph). The application typically accesses a cache instance through the Cache property of a data view. The property always returns the valid cache instance, even if it didnt exist before the property was accessed. A cache instance is also available through the Caches property of the graph to which the cache instance is bound.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Select(PX.Data.PXDataRecord,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Creates a data record from the PXDataRecord object and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status if the data record isn't found among the modified data records in the cache.

remarks.para: If isReadOnly is false then:

item.description: If the cache already contains the data record with the same keys and the NotChanged status, the method returns this data record updated to the state of PXDataRecord.
If the cache contains the same data record with the Updated or Inserted status, the method returns this data record.

remarks.para: In other cases and when isReadonly is true, the method returns the data record created from the PXDataRecord object.
If the AllowSelect property is false, the methods returns a new empty data record and the logic described above is not executed.
The method raises the RowSelecting event.

member.param: The PXDataRecord object to convert to the DAC type of the cache.
The index of the first field to read in the list of columns comprising the PXDataRecord object.
The value indicating if the data record with the same key fields should be located in the cache and updated.
The value indicating whether the data record with the same keys existed in the cache among the modified data records.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.GetStatus(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the provided data record status. The PXEntryStatus enumeration defines the possible status values. For example, the status can indicate whether the data record has been inserted, updated, or deleted.
member.param: The data record whose status is requested.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code snippet below shows how to check a data record status in an event handler.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.SetStatus(System.Object,PX.Data.PXEntryStatus)
member.summary: Sets the status to the provided data record. The PXEntryStatus enumeration defines the possible status values.
member.param: The data record to set status to.
The new status.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Locate(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as the provided data record. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method retrieves the data record from the database and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status. The method returns the located or retrieved data record.
member.remarks: The AllowSelect property does not affect this method unlike the Locate(IDictionary) method.
member.param: The data record to locate in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Locate(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as in the provided dictionary. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method initializes a new data record with the provided values and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status.
member.remarks: Returns 1 if a data record is successfully located or placed into the cache, and returns 0 if placing into the cache fails or the AllowSelect property is false.
member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Completely removes provided data recors from the cache object without raising any events.
member.param: The data record to remove from the cache.
member.remarks: Please, keep in mind that this method will not remove any records from the database itself but only from the cache.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below locates a data record in the cache and, if the data record has not been changed, silently removes it from the cache. (The Held status indicates that a data record has not been changed but needs to the preserved in the session.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.readItem(`0)
member.summary: Reads a row from the Database. Raises the OnRowSelecting event.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Update(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Updates the data record in the cache with the provided values.

remarks.para: The method initalizes a data record with the provided key fields. If the data record with such keys does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
If the AllowUpdate property is false, the data record is not updated and the methods returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully updated or inserted.

member.param: The values of the key fields of the data record to update.
The new values with which the data record fields are updated.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the cache.

remarks.para: If the data record does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
The AllowUpdate property does not affect the method unlike the Update(IDictionary, IDictionary) method.

member.param: The data record to update in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new data record using the provided field values and inserts the data record into the cache. Returns 1 in case of successful insertion, 0 otherwise.
member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.

The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The values provided in the dictionary are not readonly and can be updated during execution of the method. The method is typically used by the system when the values are received from the user interface. If the AllowInsert property is false, the data record is not inserted and the method returns 0.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record or null if the data record wasn't inserted.
member.param: The data record to insert into the cache.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.
The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The AllowInsert property does not affect this method unlike the Insert(IDictionary) method.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below initializes a new instance of the APInvoice data record and inserts it into the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Extend``1(``0)
member.summary: Initializes a data record of the DAC type of the cache from the provided data record of the base DAC type and inserts the new data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record.
member.param: The data record of the base DAC type, the field values of which are used to initialize the data record.
member.example: See the Extend<Parent>(Parent) method of the PXSelectBase<> class.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Insert
member.summary: Initializes a new data record with default values and inserts it into the cache by invoking the Insert(object) method. Returns the new data record inserted into the cache.

summary.para: Returns a new DAC type data record. This method must be used to initialize a data record that is of an appropriate type for the PXCache instance when its DAC type is unknown.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.ClearQueryCacheObsolete
member.summary: Clears the internal cache of database query results.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.ClearQueryCache
member.summary: Clears the internal cache of database query results.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Delete(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes the data record with the provided key values and places it into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.
member.param: The values of key fields.
The values of all fields. The parameter is not used in the method.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldUpdated, RowDeleting, and RowDeleted events. See Deleting a Data Record for the events flowchart.

This method is typically used to process deletion initiated from the user interface. If the AllowDelete property is false, the data record is not marked deleted and the method returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully marked deleted.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Places the data record into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.
member.param: The data record to delete.

remarks.para: The method raises the RowDeleting and RowDeleted events.
The AllowDelete property does not affect this method.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Dirty
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated, inserted, and deleted data records. The collection contains data records with the Updated, Inserted, or Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Updated
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Updated status.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following example shows how to iterate over all updated data records.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Inserted
member.summary: Gets the collection of inserted data records that does not exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Inserted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Cached
member.summary: Get the collection of all cached data records. The collection contains data records with any status. The developer should not rely on the presense of data records with statuses other than Updated, Inserted, and Deleted in this collection.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Deleted
member.summary: Gets the collection of deleted data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache`1.IsInsertedUpdatedDeleted
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates if the cache contains modified data records to be saved to database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Persist(PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modifications of a particular type from the cache to the database. Returns the number of saved data records.

remarks.para: Using this method, you can update, delete, or insert all data records kept by the cache. You can also perform different operations at once by passing a combination of PXDBOperation values, such as PXDBOperation.Insert | PXDBOperation.Update.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.

member.param: The value that indicates the types of database operations to execute, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Persist(System.Object,PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modification of the specified type from the cache to the database for a particular data record.
member.param: The data record to save to the database.
The database operation to perform for the data record, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistUpdated(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the database. Returns true if the data record has been updated sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to update in the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistInserted(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the database. Returns true if the data record has been inserted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method throws an exception if the data record with such keys exists in the database.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to insert into the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.PersistDeleted(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the provided data record from the database by the key fields. Returns true if the data record has been deleted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to deleted from the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache`1.Persisted(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes saving changes to the database by raising the RowPersisted event for all persisted data records.
member.param: The value indicating whether the database operation has been aborted or completed.

code.title: Example
code.description: You need to call this method in the application only when you call the Persist(), PersistInserted(), PersistUpdated(), or PersistDeleted() method, as the following example shows.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache.AllowUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the cache allows update of data records from the user interface. This value does not affect the ability to update a data record via the methods. By default, the property equals true.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache.AllowInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the cache allows insertion of data records from the user interface. This value does not affect the ability to insert a data record via the methods. By default, the property equals true.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCache.AllowDelete
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the cache allows deletion of data records from the user interface. This value does not affect the ability to delete a data record via the methods. By default, the property equals true.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.GetItemType
member.summary: Gets the type of data rows in the cache.
member.returns: Containing type.

summary.para: Gets or sets the current data record. This property can point to the last data record displayed in the user interface. If the user selects a data record in a grid, this property points to this data record. If the user or the application inserts, updates, or deletes a data record, the property points to this data record. Insertion and update of records through the API methods also assign this property.

remarks.para: When this property is assigned, the RowSelected event is raised.
You can reference the Current data record and its fields in the PXSelect BQL statements by using the Current parameter.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXCache.ActiveRow

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXCache.RowsToMove
member.summary: Allows to pass data keys of the rows that need to be moved.

member.summary: Compares the values of the key fields. The list of key fields is taken from the cache.

IBqlTable or IDictionary
member.returns: Returns true if the values of the key fields are equal.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.ObjectsEqual``1(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the values of the specified fields.
member.param: The first row to compare.
The second row to compare.
member.typeparam: The field to compare.
member.returns: Returns true if the values of the specified fields in the specified rows are equal.

code.title: Example
code.description: To check whether a field has been changed, you use the ObjectsEqual<>() method of the cache as follows.

example.code: if (!sender.ObjectsEqual<ShipmentLine.lineQty>(newLine, oldLine) ...

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.ObjectsEqual``2(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the values of two fields in the specified records.
member.param: The first row to compare.
The second row to compare.
member.typeparam: The first field to compare.
The second field to compare.
member.returns: If the values of any of the fields you specify differ, the data records are considered different and the method returns false.

code.title: Example
code.description: You can specify up to eight fields as type parameters of the ObjectsEqual<>() method to compare two data records by using these fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.Update(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary:
Places row into the cache with status Updated.
If row does not exists in the cache, looks for it in database.
If row does not exists in database, inserts row with status Inserted.
Raise events OnRowUpdating, OnRowUpdated and other events.
This method is used to update row from user interface.
Flag AllowUpdate may cancel this method.
returns 1 if updated successfully, otherwise 0.
member.param: Primary key of the item.
New field values to update the item with.
member.returns: 1 if updated successfully, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.Update(System.Object)
member.summary:
Places row into the cache with status Updated.
If row does not exists in the cache, looks for it in database.

member.summary: Looks for a row in the cache collection. If the row has the deleted or insertedDeleted status, the method returns null. Returns the row inserted to the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.PlaceNotChanged(System.Object,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Looks for a row in the cache collection. If the row has the deleted or insertedDeleted status, the method returns null. If the status of the row is inserted or updated, the wasUpdated flag is true. Returns the row inserted to cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.Select(PX.Data.PXDataRecord,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Creates a data record from the PXDataRecord object and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status if the data record isn't found among the modified data records in the cache.
member.param: The PXDataRecord object to convert to the DAC type of the cache.
The index of the first field to read in the list of columns comprising the PXDataRecord object.
The value that indicates (if true) that the data record with the same key fields should be located in the cache and updated.
The value that indicates (if true) that the data record with the same keys existed in the cache among the modified data records.

remarks.para: If isReadOnly is false then:

list.item: If the cache already contains the data record with the same keys and the NotChanged status, the method returns this data record updated to the state of PXDataRecord.
If the cache contains the same data record with the Updated or Inserted status, the method returns this data record.

remarks.para: In other cases and when isReadonly is true, the method returns the data record created from the PXDataRecord object.
If the AllowSelect property is false, the methods returns a new empty data record and the logic described above is not executed.
The method raises the RowSelecting event.

member.remarks: The collection contains data records with any status. The developer should not rely on the presence of data records with statuses other than Updated, Inserted, and Deleted in this collection.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCache._CacheAttachedDelegate
member.summary: The internal delegate for the CacheAttached event.
member.param: (Required). The object to which the cache is attached.
(Required). The object that raised the event.

remarks.para: The CacheAttached handler is used to override data access class (DAC) field attributes declared directly within the DAC. By declaring a CacheAttached handler and attaching appropriate attributes to the handler within a graph, the developer forces the framework to completely override DAC field attributes within this graph.
The execution order for the CacheAttached event handlers is the following:

list.item: Attribute event handlers are executed.
Graph event handlers are executed.

code.title: Example
code.description: You should define a graph event handler as follows. Event handlers in particular graphs do not have the graph parameter.

example.code: [DAC_Field_Attribute_1] ... [DAC_Field_Attribute_N] protected virtual void DACName_FieldName_CacheAttached(PXCache sender) { ... }

code.title: Example2
code.description: The code below overrides DAC field attributes within a graph.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCache.RaiseExceptionHandling(System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Exception)
member.summary: Raises the ExceptionHandling event for the specified field and data record.
member.param: The name of the field for which the event is raised. The parameter is case-insensitive.
The data record for which the event is raised.
The new value of the current field generated by the operation that causes the exception.
The exception that causes the event.

remarks.para: RaiseExceptionHandling, which is used to prevent the saving of a record or to display an error or warning on the form, cannot be invoked on a PXCache instance in the following event handlers:

list.item: FieldDefaulting: This event handler works with a record that has not yet been added to PXCache or a record whose field is changed in the code. Neither situation involves the display of errors or warning for a record.
FieldSelecting: This event handler is used to configure a UI control of a field. The invocation of PXCache.RaiseExceptionHandling in this event handler has no effect.

RowSelecting: This event handler is called when the record is being read from the database. These records are not available in PXCache yet. Invocation of PXCache.RaiseExceptionHandling in this event handler has no effect.
RowPersisted: This event handler is called when the record has already been saved to the database. Therefore, it would not make sense to display any warnings for this record.

remarks.para: RaiseExceptionHandling usually is invoked in the following event handlers:

list.item: RowPersistingto prevent saving of a record
RowSelectedto display an error or warning on the form

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1
member.summary: Represents the cache of modified data records from a paricular table and the controller for basic operations over these data records. The type parameter is set to the data access class (DAC) that represents this table.
member.typeparam: The DAC type of data records stored in the cache object.

remarks.para: The cache objects consists conceptually of two parts:

item.description: The collections of the data records that were modified and not yet saved to the database, such as Updated, Inserted, Deleted, and Dirty.
The controller that executes basic data-related operations through the use of the methods, such as Update(object), Insert(object), Delete(object), Persist(PXDBOperation), and other methods.

remarks.para: During execution of these methods, the cache raises events. The graph and attributes can subscribe to these events to implement business logic. The methods applied to a previously unchanged data record result in placing of the data record into the cache.

The system creates and destroys PXCache instances (caches) on each request. If the user or the code modifies a data record, it is placed into the cache. When request execution is completed, the system serializes the modified records from the caches to the session. At run time, the cache may also include the unchanged data records retrieved during request execution. These data records are discarded once the request is served.

On the next round trip, the modified data records are loaded from the session to the caches. The cache merges the data retrieved from the database with the modified data, and the application accesses the data as if the entire data set has been preserved from the time of previous request.
The cache maintains the modified data until the changes are discarded or saved to the database.
The cache is the issuer of all data-related events, which can be handled by the graph and attributes.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.HasAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the provided data record has any attributes attached to its fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field in the DAC.
member.remarks: The system maintains instances of attributes on three different levels. On its instantiation, a cache object copies appropriate attributes from the global level to the cache level and stores them in an internal collection. When an attribute needs to be modified for a particular data record, the cache creates item-level copies of all attributes and stores them associated with the data record.
member.param: The name of the field whose attributes are returned. If null, the method returns attributes from all fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.GetAttributesReadonly(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the cache-level instances of attributes placed on the specified field in the DAC.
member.remarks: Using this method, you can prevent expanding the aggregate attributes by setting the second parameter to false. Other overloads of this method always include both the aggregate attributes and the attributes that comprise such attributes.
member.param: The data record.

The value that indicates whether the attributes embedded into an aggregate attribute are included into the list. If true, both the aggregate attribute and the attributes embedded into it are included in the list. Otherwise, only the aggregate attribute is included. An aggregate attribute is an attribute that derives from the PXAggregateAttribute class. This class allows combining multiple different attributes in a single one.

If such instances are not exist for the provided data record, the method creates them by copying all cache-level attributes and storing them in the internal collection that contains the data record specific attributes. To avoid cloning cache-level attributes, use the GetAttributesReadonly(object, string) method.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current data record. This property points to the last data record displayed in the user interface. If the user selects a data record in a grid, this property points to this data record. If the user or the application inserts, updates, or deletes a data record, the property points to this data record. Assigning this property raises the RowSelected event.
member.remarks: You can reference the Current data record and its fields in the PXSelect BQL statements by using the Current parameter.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Select(PX.Data.PXDataRecord,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Creates a data record from the PXDataRecord object and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status if the data record isn't found among the modified data records in the cache.

remarks.para: If isReadOnly is false then:

item.description: If the cache already contains the data record with the same keys and the NotChanged status, the method returns this data record updated to the state of PXDataRecord.
If the cache contains the same data record with the Updated or Inserted status, the method returns this data record.

remarks.para: In other cases and when isReadonly is true, the method returns the data record created from the PXDataRecord object.
If the AllowSelect property is false, the methods returns a new empty data record and the logic described above is not executed.
The method raises the RowSelecting event.

member.param: The PXDataRecord object to convert to the DAC type of the cache.
The index of the first field to read in the list of columns comprising the PXDataRecord object.
The value indicating if the data record with the same key fields should be located in the cache and updated.
The value indicating whether the data record with the same keys existed in the cache among the modified data records.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.GetStatus(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the status of the provided data record. The PXEntryStatus enumeration defines the possible status values. For example, the status can indicate whether the data record has been inserted, updated, or deleted.
member.param: The data record whose status is requested.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.SetStatus(System.Object,PX.Data.PXEntryStatus)
member.summary: Sets the status to the provided data record. The PXEntryStatus enumeration defines the possible status values.
member.param: The data record to set status to.
The new status.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Locate(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as the provided data record. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method retrieves the data record from the database and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status. The method returns the located or retrieved data record.
member.remarks: The AllowSelect property does not affect this method unlike the Locate(IDictionary) method.
member.param: The data record to locate in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Locate(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Searches the cache for a data record that has the same key fields as in the provided dictionary. If the data record is not found in the cache, the method initializes a new data record with the provided values and places it into the cache with the NotChanged status.
member.remarks: Returns 1 if a data record is successfully located or placed into the cache, and returns 0 if placing into the cache fails or the AllowSelect property is false.
member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Completely removes the provided data record from the cache without raising any events.
member.param: The data record to remove from the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Update(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Updates the data record in the cache with the provided values.

remarks.para: The method initalizes a data record with the provided key fields. If the data record with such keys does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
If the AllowUpdate property is false, the data record is not updated and the methods returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully updated or inserted.

member.param: The values of the key fields of the data record to update.
The new values with which the data record fields are updated.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the cache.

remarks.para: If the data record does not exist in the cache, the method tries to retrieve it from the database. If the data record exists in the cache or database, it gets the Updated status. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method inserts a new data record into the cache with the Inserted status.

The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowUpdating, and RowUpdated. See Updating a Data Record for the events flowchart. If the data record does not exist in the database, the method also causes the events of the Insert(object) method.
The AllowUpdate property does not affect the method unlike the Update(IDictionary, IDictionary) method.

member.param: The data record to update in the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Insert(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new data record using the provided field values and inserts the data record into the cache. Returns 1 in case of successful insertion, and 0 otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.

The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The values provided in the dictionary are not readonly and can be updated during execution of the method. The method is typically used by the system when the values are received from the user interface. If the AllowInsert property is false, the data record is not inserted and the method returns 0.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

member.param: The dictionary with values to initialize the data record fields. The dictionary keys are field names.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Insert(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record or null if the data record wasn't inserted.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldDefaulting, FieldUpdating, FieldVerifying, FieldUpdated, RowInserting, and RowInserted. See Inserting a Data Record for the events chart.
The method does not check if the data record exists in the database. The AllowInsert property does not affect this method unlike the Insert(IDictionary) method.
In case of successful insertion, the method marks the data record as Inserted, and it becomes accessible through the Inserted collection.

member.param: The data record to insert into the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Extend``1(``0)
member.summary: Initializes a data record of the DAC type of the cache from the provided data record of the base DAC type and inserts the new data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record.
member.param: The data record of the base DAC type which field values are used to initialize the data record.
member.example: See the Extend<Parent>(Parent) method of the PXSelectBase<> class.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Insert
member.summary: Initializes a new data record with default values and inserts it into the cache by invoking the Insert(object) method. Returns the new data record inserted into the cache.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.CreateInstance
member.summary: Returns a new data record of the DAC type of the cache. The method may be used to initialize a data record of the type appropriate for the PXCache instance when its DAC type is unknown.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.ClearQueryCacheObsolete
member.summary: Clears the internal cache of database query results.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Delete(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes the data record with the provided key values and places it into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: FieldUpdating, FieldUpdated, RowDeleting, and RowDeleted events. See Deleting a Data Record for the events flowchart.

This method is typically used to process deletion initiated from the user interface. If the AllowDelete property is false, the data record is not marked deleted and the method returns 0. The method returns 1 if the data record is successfully marked deleted.

member.param: The values of key fields.
The values of all fields. The parameter is not used in the method.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Places the data record into the cache with the Deleted or InsertedDeleted status. The method assigns the InsertedDeleted status to the data record if it has the Inserted status when the method is invoked.

remarks.para: The method raises the RowDeleting and RowDeleted events. See for the events flowchart.
The AllowDelete property does not affect this method.

member.param: The data record to delete.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Dirty
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated, inserted, and deleted data records. The collection contains data records with the Updated, Inserted, or Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Updated
member.summary: Gets the collection of updated data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Updated status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Inserted
member.summary: Gets the collection of inserted data records that does not exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Inserted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Cached
member.summary: Get the collection of all cached data records. The collection contains data records with any status. The developer should not rely on the presense of data records with statuses other than Updated, Inserted, and Deleted in this collection.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Deleted
member.summary: Gets the collection of deleted data records that exist in the database. The collection contains data records with the Deleted status.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.IsInsertedUpdatedDeleted
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates if the cache contains modified data records to be saved to database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Persist(PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modifications of a particular type from the cache to the database. Returns the number of saved data records.

remarks.para: Using this method, you can update, delete, or insert all data records kept by the cache. You can also perform different operations at once by passing a combination of PXDBOperation values, such as PXDBOperation.Insert | PXDBOperation.Update.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.

member.param: The value that indicates the types of database operations to execute, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Persist(System.Object,PX.Data.PXDBOperation)
member.summary: Saves the modification of the specified type from the cache to the database for a particular data record.
member.param: The data record to save to the database.
The database operation to perform for the data record, either one of PXDBOperation.Insert, PXDBOperation.Update, and PXDBOperation.Delete values or their bitwise "or" (|) combination.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.PersistUpdated(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the provided data record in the database. Returns true if the data record has been updated sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to update in the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.PersistInserted(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the database. Returns true if the data record has been inserted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method throws an exception if the data record with such keys exists in the database.
The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to insert into the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.PersistDeleted(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the provided data record from the database by the key fields. Returns true if the data record has been deleted sucessfully, or false otherwise.

remarks.para: The method raises the following events: RowPersisting, CommandPreparing, RowPersisted, ExceptionHandling.
The default behavior can be modified by the PXDBInterceptor attribute.

member.param: The data record to deleted from the database.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXModelExtension`1.Persisted(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes saving changes to the database by raising the RowPersisted event for all persisted data records.
member.param: The value indicating whether the database operation has been aborted or completed.

member.summary: Serializes the cache to the session.

summary.para: A static class that is used to execute a long-running operation, such as processing data or releasing a document, asynchronously in a separate thread. This class manages the threads created on the Acumatica ERP server to process long-running operations.

summary.para: From the custom information dictionary of the long-running operation specified by the parameter, returns the data object that is stored under the key that is defined by the parameter. If the static class does not contain a long-running operation with the key specified in the parameter, the method returns null. Otherwise, the method does the following:

Otherwise: Returns the data object that is stored under the key specified in the parameter

The key to access the data object in the custom information dictionary of the long-running operation specified by the first parameter.

Otherwise: Returns the data object that is stored under the key specified in the parameter

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXView.RaiseCommandPreparingForFilterValue(PX.Data.PXCache,System.String,System.Object,PX.Data.PXDBOperation,System.Type,PX.Data.PXFieldState,PX.Data.PXCommandPreparingEventArgs.FieldDescription@)
member.summary: Raises the cache command preparing field event for filter value with a special treatment for the . The may convert the date filter value from local time zone to UTC if its flags and both are set. This results in a shift in the filter value and a value 01.09.2020 00:00 corresponding to the 1st of September 2020 will be shifted to a 01.09.2020 05:00 which will return incorrect filtered results. Depending on the time zone it can even result in a different date. This is unwanted therefore for filter values these flags on attribute are temporarily cleared to prevent time zone conversions.
member.param: The cache.
Name of the field on which cache command preparing event should be raised.
The filter value.
The operation.
The table to use for the command preparing event.
The field state.
[out] Field description.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXFilterableAttribute
member.summary: Enables the Filter Settings dialog for the grid, in which the user can define and save custom filters and then use them every time this user opens the form.

remarks.para: The attribute is placed on the view declaration.

If you specify this view as the data member of a grid control, the grid will include a control which can be used to create reusable filters and save them in the database. A reusable filter is a set of conditions checked for the fields selected by the view. When a grid applies a filter it displays only the data records that satisfy the filter's conditions.

Reusable filters are frequently enabled in the grid on inquiry and processing forms, so that users can customize these forms to show specific data that is most relevant to their needs and responsibilities.

example.code: [PXFilterable] public PXSelect<APInvoice> APDocumentList;

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFilterableAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute. The parameter is optional and is not used in most cases. You can specify the DACs whose Current objects will be used to fill in the filter parameters before showing the data view to the user.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFilterableAttribute.EncloseAdvancedFilterRows(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.ValueTuple{PX.Data.PXFilterRow,PX.Data.FilterRow.FilterTypeEnum,System.Int32}})
member.summary: Enclose advanced filters in brackets to be consistent with UI behavior (AC-234045)
member.remarks: When user creates both advanced (A1 OR A2) and quick filters (Q1 AND Q2), it will be saved as plain list without brackets as "A1 OR A2 AND Q1 AND Q2". When this filter is applied to the query, advanced filters will be surrounded with brackets to be consistent with the UI behavior: "(A1 OR A2) AND Q1 AND Q2". This method wraps advanced filters if the following conditions are met: 1. More than one advanced filter in the set 2. There is at least one non-advanced (quick) filter in the set 3. Non-advanced (quick) filters are not placed between advanced filters

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXConnectionScope
member.summary: Objects of this class are connection scopes for executing BQL statements.
member.remarks: When a long database operation is being performed, you must create another connection scope to perform other operations with the database without waiting for the first operation to finish. For example, a separate connection scope is needed in the RowSelecting event handler to execute additional BQL statements.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope
member.summary: This class allows you to implement some logic within a transaction. If a transaction cannot be completed, the performed actions will be rolled back.

remarks.para: We recommend that you create a PXTransactionScope object in a using statement, implement in the using body the logic that is necessary for a transaction, and call the Complete method as the last command of the using body.

innovasys:widget.innovasys:widgetproperty: If you nest a transaction scope into another, the inner and outer transaction scopes will use the same database transaction. If the Complete method of the outer transaction scope is not executed, the transaction will be rolled back.

code.description: Following is the usage pattern for the <tt>PXTransactionScope</tt> class.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope._Enlisted
member.summary: If the transaction scope is enlisted then it's not the top most transaction scope.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.Complete
member.summary: Completes the transaction.
member.remarks: Run this method after all other operations within a transaction, but before the transaction scope object is destroyed.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.Complete(PX.Data.PXGraph)
member.summary: Completes the transaction.
member.remarks: Run this method after all other operations within a transaction, but before the transaction scope object is destroyed.
member.param: If not null, the timestamp value is stored for this graph.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.Restart
member.summary: Clears the active scope and all its parent scopes.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.Dispose
member.summary: This method performs the COMMIT operation if the Complete method was called; otherwise, the ROLLBACK operation is performed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.IsScoped
member.summary: Returns true, if a transaction scope is set. Otherwise, it returns false.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.IsConnectionOutOfScope
member.summary: Returns true if a transaction scope is set but the current connection was created in a separate PXConnectionScope.

member.name: E:PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.OnBeforeCommit
member.summary: The event is raised for the top most transaction before the COMMIT operation. Using this event, you can perform the ROLLBACK operation instead of the COMMIT operation.

member.name: T:PX.Data.UserRecords.IUserRecordsDBUpdater
member.summary: An interface for the user records database updater. Updates a batch of user records in the database when completes. This functionality works together with functionality. Inside the attribute on DAC's row persisted event we add an entry to a special list inside the root transaction scope. This entry contains information required to update user records at the end of transaction, similar to a mechanism Audit uses. The reason for a special treatment is a high number of DB deadlocks caused by the concurrent access to the VisitedRecord DB table when we process each record separately inside .

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute
member.summary: Sets up a button that is used to initiate the action in the user interface.

remarks.para: This attribute should be placed on the declaration of the method that implements the action.

Through attribute's parameters, you can configure some properties of the button, such ImageUrl, ShortcutChar, and Tooltip. To configure other layout properties, such as DisplayName, Visible, or Enabled, use the PXUIField attribute. Still some other properties can be set only on an ASPX page.
A number of other attributes derive from the PXButton attributes. These attribute do not implement additional logic and only set certain properties to specific values.

code.title: Example
code.description: An example of using the attribute without parameters is given below.

code.title: Example2
code.description: In the example below the button is disabled by default (it can be enabled in code). Also, the ImageKey property sets a specific image to be displayed on the button.

example.code:
public PXAction<VendorR> viewCustomer;
[PXUIField(DisplayName = Messages.ViewCustomer, Enabled = false, Visible = true, MapEnableRights = PXCacheRights.Select, MapViewRights = PXCacheRights.Select)] [PXButton(ImageKey = PX.Web.UI.Sprite.Main.Process)] public virtual IEnumerable ViewCustomer(PXAdapter adapter) { ... }

code.title: Example3
code.description: In the example below, the attribute provides specific URLs of the images displayed on the button by default (ImageUrl) when it is disabled (DisabledImageUrl). The tooltip is also set.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PXButton attribute.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutCtrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the keyboard shortcut for the button includes the Ctrl key.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the keyboard shortcut for the button includes the Shift key.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.SpecialType
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXSpecialButtonType value that indicates whether a button has a special type, such as Save, Cancel, or Refresh, or does not have. A button of a special type may be searched, for instance, by graph methods in special occassions (the PressSave() method searches visible buttons of Save type and selects the first of them). By default, the property is set to PXSpecialButtonType.Default.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.OnClosingPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets the special type of the button that will be triggerred on closing of an application webpage that is opened in popup mode.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ClosePopup
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the enclosing popup is closed once the button logic is executed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.PopupVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the button is visible when the enclosing webpage is opened in popup mode.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.CommitChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether a button press posts modifications to the server.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ShortcutChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used as the keyboard shorcut for the button. Setting additionally the ShortcutCtrl and ShortcutShift properties adds or removes Ctrl and Shift keys to and from the shortcut.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that identifies the image set. Forms the first part of the button image URL.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that identifies the button image within the set specified by ImageSet. Forms the second part of the button image URL.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the button when it is enabled.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.DisabledImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the button when it is disabled.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.HoverImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed on the enabled button on hover.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the string displayed as a tooltip for the button.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ConfirmationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXConfirmationType value that indicates in what cases the confirmation message is shown to a user on a button press. By default, the property is set to PXConfirmationType.Unspecified.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.ConfirmationMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the confirmation message that can be shown to a user on a button press. The cases when the configramtion message is shown depend on ConfirmationType.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.MenuAutoOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates (if set to true) that a button click only expands the menu with other buttons.
member.value: If the value is true, the button click opens the menu and does not trigger a button's action.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.DisplayOnMainToolbar
member.summary: Indicates whether the action is visible on the main toolbar.
member.remarks:
The following values can be assigned:
true: Makes the action visible on the main toolbar
false: Makes the action invisible on the main toolbar If no value is assigned, the action is visible on the main toolbar if it has not been used on the screen.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXButtonAttribute.VisibleOnProcessingResults
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates (if set to true) that the button appears in the Processing dialog box of a processing page.
member.value: By default, the value is false (the button does not appear in the Processing dialog box).

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXProcessing`1

summary.para: Defines a special data view used on processing webpages, which are intended for mass processing of data records.

The PXProcessing<Table> type is used to define the data view in a graph bound to a processing webpage. A data view of this type includes definitions of two actions, Process and ProcessAll, which are added to the graph and are used to invoke the processing. You should set the processing method by invoking one of the SetProcessDelegate methods in the constructor of the graph.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXProcessingBase`1.SetProcessDelegate``1(System.Action{``0,`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Action{``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Sets the method that is invoked to process each data record and the method that is invoked after all data records are processed.

remarks.para: The processing method should have two parameters, the graph and the data record. When the user initiates processing, the data view initializes the instance of the specified graph type and passes it to the processing method while it is invoked for each data record.

The second method has the only parameter, the graph. This method is invoked once when all data record are processed. The parameter of the method is set to the graph that was passed to the processing method for each data record.

member.param: The delegate of the processing method.
The delegate of the method invoked when all data records are processed.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXPersistingCheck
member.summary: Defines different ways the PXDefault attribute checks the field value before a data record with this field is saved to the database.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXPersistingCheck.Null
member.summary: Check that the field value is not null.
member.remarks: Note that the user interface (UI) trims string values, so for fields displayed in the UI, values containing only whitespace characters will also be rejected.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXPersistingCheck.NullOrBlank
member.summary: Check that the field value is not null and is not a string that contains only whitespace characters.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXPersistingCheck.Nothing
member.summary: Do not check the field value.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXLocalizableDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Allows you to have a multi-language field with a default value in a specific language.
member.remarks: Use this attribute instead of the PXDefault attribute and specify in its second parameter either a BQL field or a BQL select that provides language selection.

code.title: Example
code.description: For example, in Acumatica ERP, the SOLine line description defaulted to the appropriate InventoryItem description based on the language that is set for a customer. The TransactionDesr field of the SOLine DAC has the PXLocalizableDefault attribute with a second parameter that specifies the language as follows: typeof(Customer.languageName).

example.code: PXLocalizableDefault(typeof(Search<InventoryItem.descr, Where<InventoryItem.inventoryID, Equal<Current<SOLine.inventoryID>>>>), typeof(Customer.languageName), PersistingCheck = PXPersistingCheck.Nothing)]

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Sets the default value for a DAC field.

remarks.para: The PXDefault attribute provides the default value for a DAC field. The default value is assigned to the field when the cache raises the FiedlDefaulting event. This happens when the a new row is inserted in code or through the user interface.

A value specified as default can be a constant or the result of a BQL query. If you provide a BQL query, the attribute will execute it on the FieldDefaulting event. You can specify both, in which case the attribute first executes the BQL query and uses the constant if the BQL query returns an empty set. If you provide a DAC field as the BQL query, the attribute takes the value of this field from the cache object's Current property. The attribute uses the cache object of the DAC type in which the field is defined.

The PXDefault attribute also checks that the field value is not null before saving to the database. You can adjust this behavior using the PersistingCheck property. Its value indicates whether the attribute should check that the value is not null, check that the value is not null or a blank string, or not check.
The attribute can redirect the error that happened on the field to another field if you set the MapErrorTo property.
You can use the static methods to change the attribute properties for a particular data record in the cache or for all data record in the cache.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.SearchOnDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the BQL query specified calculate the default value is executed or ignored. By default, is true (the BQL query is executed).

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.PersistingCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets the PXPersistingCheck value that defines how to check the field value for null before saving a data record to the database. If a value doesn't pass a check, the attribute will throw the PXRowPersistingException exception. As a result, the save action will fail and the user will get an error message.
member.remarks: By default, the property equals PXPersistingCheck.Null, which disallows null values. Note that for fields that are displayed in the user interface, this setting also disallows blank values (containing only whitespce characters).

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.MapErrorTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that redirects the error from the field the attribute is placed on (source field) to another field. If an error happens on the source field, the error message will be displayed over the input control of the other field. The property can be set to a type derived from IBqlField. The BQL query is set in a constructor.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.Constant
member.summary: Gets or sets a constant value that will be used as the default value.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.SourceField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field whose value will be taken from the BQL query result and used as the default value. (The BQL query is set in a constructor.)
member.value: The property can be set to a type derived from IBqlField.

example.code: [PXDefault( typeof( Select<VendorClass, Where<VendorClass.vendorClassID, Equal<Current<Vendor.vendorClassID>>>>), SourceField = typeof(VendorClass.allowOverrideRate))] public virtual Boolean? AllowOverrideRate { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that calculates the default value using the provided BQL query.
member.param: The BQL query that is used to calculate the default value. Accepts the types derived from: IBqlSearch, IBqlSelect, IBqlField, IBqlTable.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that defines the default value as a constant value.
member.param: Constant value that is used as the default value.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXDefaultAttribute.#ctor(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that calculates the default value using the provided BQL query and uses the constant value if the BQL query returns nothing. If the BQL query is of Select type, you should also explicitly set the SourceField property. If the BQL query is a DAC field, the attribute will take the value from the Current property of the cache object corresponding to the DAC.
member.param: Constant value that is used as the default value.
The BQL query that is used to calculate the default value. Accepts the types derived from: IBqlSearch, IBqlSelect, IBqlField, IBqlTable.
member.example:
The attribute below will execute the Select BQL query and take the VendorClass.AllowOverrideRate field value from the result or will use false as the default value if the BQL query returns an empty set.
[PXDefault( false, typeof( Select<VendorClass, Where<VendorClass.vendorClassID, Equal<Current<Vendor.vendorClassID>>>>), SourceField = typeof(VendorClass.allowOverrideRate))] public virtual Boolean? AllowOverrideRate { get; set; }
