member.name: T:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute
member.summary: Adds fields to the search index and configures the search result.

remarks.para: This attribute is assigned to the NoteID DAC field. A search is performed in the fields that are specified in this attribute (in the fourth parameter of the constructor) and in the key fields.
After you change the set of searchable fields of a DAC in its PXSearchable attribute, rebuild the search indexes for this DAC on the Rebuild Full-Text Entity Index (SM209500) form.
We also strongly recommend that you rebuild the search indexes of all DACs after every database upgrade.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.Line1Format
member.summary: The format of the first line of the search result that is displayed. Numbers in curly braces reference to the fields listed in Line1Fields.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.Line2Format
member.summary: The format of the second line of the search result that is displayed. Numbers in curly braces reference to the fields listed in Line2Fields.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.Line1Fields
member.summary: The fields that are referenced from Line1Format.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.Line2Fields
member.summary: The fields that are referenced from Line2Format.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.NumberFields
member.summary: List of the fields to be indexed that contain numbers with prefixes (for example, "CT00000040").
member.remarks: If a field contains a number with a prefix (like "CT00000040"), then searching for "0040" can pose a problem. All fields that are listed in NumberFields will get special treatment and will be indexed both with a prefix and without one ("CT00000040", "00000040").

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.SelectDocumentUser
member.summary: The Select<> construction that selects the users of the documents which must be available in the search result.
member.remarks: If this Select<> construction is specified, then only those records or documents are shown that were created either by the current user or by a user from the returned set. The company tree hierarchy is not traversed. For example, you can use this setting to filter expense claims, timecards, etc.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.WhereConstraint
member.summary: Constraint that defines whether the given DAC instance is searchable or not.
member.remarks: For example, the Contact DAC is used to represent different types of records: the lead contacts are searchable, while the accountProperty contacts are not.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.MatchWithJoin
member.summary: When a MatchWith type is used, the MatchWithJoin property must contain a join for the entity containing the GroupMask column.
member.remarks:
For example, the graph that manages ARInvoice objects contains the following Match operator in the Document object:
Match<Customer, Current<AccessInfo.userName>>
So the MatchWithJoin property must contain a join to the Customer table:
typeof(InnerJoin<Customer, On<Customer.bAccountID, Equal<ARInvoice.customerID>>>)

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.SelectForFastIndexing
member.summary: The SelectForFastIndexing request is used to define the relationship between the searchable fields and thus make it possible to rebuild the Full Text Search index and to use fields from other DACs in LineFields.
member.remarks: A search can involve additional joined tables, so that all searchable fields are retrieved by a single select request, and this prevents lazy loading of rows using the selector.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSearchableAttribute.ForeignDacFieldRetrievalInfos
member.summary: The information for a complex search result creation regarding retrieval of values for fields from other DACs which don't have a selector attribute declared on them.
member.value: The information for a complex search result creation regarding retrieval of values for fields from other DACs which don't have a selector attribute declared on them.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute
member.summary: Configures the lookup control for a DAC field that references a data record from a particular table by holding its key field.See

remarks.para: The attribute configures the input control for a DAC field that references a data record from a particular table. Such field holds a key value that identifies the data record in this table.

The input control will be of "lookup" type (may also be called a "selector"). A user can either input the value for the field manually or select from the list of the data records. If a value is inserted manually, the attribute checks if it is included in the list. You can specify a complex BQL query to define the set of data records that appear in the list.

The key field usually represents a database identity column that may not be user-friendly (surrogate key). It is possible to substitute its value with the value of another field from the same data record (natural key). This field should be specified in the SubstituteKey property. In this case, the table, and the DAC, have two fields that uniquely identify a data record from this table. For example, the Account table may have the numeric AccountID field and the user-friendly string AccountCD field. On a field that references Account data records in another DAC, you should place the PXSelector attribute as follows.
The attribute will automatically convert the stored numeric value to the displayed string value and back. Note that only the AccountCD property should be marked with IsKey property set to true.

It is also possible to define the list of columns to display. You can use an appropriated constructor and specify the types of the fields. By default, all fields that have the PXUIField attribute's Visibility property set to PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible.

Along with a key, some other field can be displayed as the description of the key. This field should be specified in the DescriptionField property. The way the description is displayed in the lookup control is configured in the webpage layout through the DisplayMode property of the PXSelector control. The default display format is ValueField DescriptionField. It can be changed to display the description only.
To achieve better performance, the attribute can be configured to cache the displayed data records.

code.title: Example
code.description: The example below shows the simplest PXSelector attribute declaration. All Category data records will be available for selection. Their CategoryCD field values will be inserted without conversion.

example.code: [PXSelector(typeof(Category.categoryCD))] public virtual string CategoryCD { get; set; }

code.title: Example2
code.description: The attribute below configures the lookup control to let the user select from the Customer data records retrieved by the Search BQL query. The displayed columns are specified explicitly: AccountCD and CompanyName.

code.title: Example3
code.description: The Customer.accountCD field data will be inserted as a value without conversion. The attribute below let the user select from the Branch data records. The attribute displays the Branch.BranchCD field value in the user interface, but actually assigns the Branch.BranchID field value to the field.

code.title: Example4
code.description: The example below shows the PXSelector attribute in combination with other attributes. Here, the PXSelector attribute configures a lookup field that will let a user select from the data set defined by the Search query. The lookup control will display descriptions the data records, taking them from CRLeadClass.description field. The attribute will cache records in memory to reduce the number of database calls.

example.code: [PXDBString(10, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">aaaaaaaaaa")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Class ID")] [PXSelector( typeof(Search<CRLeadClass.cRLeadClassID, Where<CRLeadClass.isActive, Equal<True>>>), DescriptionField = typeof(CRLeadClass.description), CacheGlobal = true)] public virtual string ClassID { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.GetSelect
member.summary: Returns Bql command used for selection of referenced records.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.CacheGlobal
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the attribute should cache the data records retrieved from the database to show in the lookup control. By default, the attribute does not cache the data records.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.DescriptionField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the referenced table that contains the description.
member.example:
In the code below, the PXSelector attribute configures a lookup field that will let a user select from the data set defined by the Search query. The lookup control will display descriptions of the data records taken from CRLeadClass.description field.
[PXDBString(10, IsUnicode = true, InputMask = ">aaaaaaaaaa")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Class ID")] [PXSelector( typeof(Search<CRLeadClass.cRLeadClassID, Where<CRLeadClass.isActive, Equal<True>>>), DescriptionField = typeof(CRLeadClass.description))] public virtual string ClassID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.FilterEntity
member.summary: Gets or sets the type that is used as a key for saved filters.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SubstituteKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the referenced table that substitutes the key field used as internal value and is displayed as a value in the user interface (natural key).
member.example:
The attribute below let the user select from the Branch data records. The attribute displays the Branch.BranchCD field value in the user interface, but actually assigns the Branch.BranchID field value to the field.
[PXSelector(typeof(Branch.branchID), SubstituteKey = typeof(Branch.branchCD))] public virtual int? BranchID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Field

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the attribute should take into account the unsaved modifications when displaying data records in control. If false, the data records are taken from the database and not merged with the cache object. If true, the data records are merged with the modification stored in the cache object.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Filterable

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.Headers

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.ValueField

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SelectorMode

... [PXSelector( typeof(FinPeriod.finPeriodID), DescriptionField = typeof(FinPeriod.descr), SelectorMode = PXSelectorMode.NoAutocomplete)] public virtual String FinPeriodID { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.PrimarySelect

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.OriginalSelect
member.summary: Gets the BQL query that was passed to the attribute on it's creation.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that will use the specified BQL query to retrieve the data records to select from. The list of displayed columns is created automatically and consists of all columns from the referenced table with the Visibility property of the PXUIField attribute set to PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible.
member.param: A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance that will use the specified BQL query to retrieve the data records to select from, and display the provided set of columns.
member.param: A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.
Fields to display in the control.
member.example:
The attribute below configures the lookup control to let the user select from the Customer data records retrieved by the Search BQL query. The displayed columns are specified explicitly: AccountCD and CompanyName. The Customer.accountCD field data will be inserted as a value without conversion.
[PXSelector( typeof(Search<Customer.accountCD, Where<Customer.companyType, Equal<CompanyType.customer>>>), new Type[] { typeof(Customer.accountCD), typeof(Customer.companyName) })] public virtual string AccountCD { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.GenerateViewName
member.summary: Generates default view name. View name is used by UI controls when selecting list of records available for selection.
member.returns: A string that references a PXView instance which will be used to retrive a list of records.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SelectSingleBound(PX.Data.PXView,System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary:
A wrapper to PXView.SelectMultiBound() method, extracts the first table in a row if a result of a join is returned.
While we are looking for a single record here, we still call SelectMulti() for performance reason, to hit cache and get the result of previously executed queries if any.
'Bound' means we will take omitted parameters from explicitly defined array of rows, not from current records set in the graph.
member.param: PXView instance to be called for a selection result
List of rows used as a source for omitted parameter values
List of parameters to be passed to the query
member.returns: Foreign record retrieved

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectorAttribute.SelectSingle(PX.Data.PXView,System.Object[])
member.summary: A wrapper to PXView.SelectSingleBound() method, extracts the first table in a row if a result of a join is returned.
member.param: PXView instance to be called for a selection result
List of parameters to be passed to the query
member.returns: Foreign record retrieved

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCustomSelectorAttribute
member.summary: The base class for custom selector attributes. To create a custom selector attribute, you derive a class from this class and implement the GetRecords() method, as shown in the example below.
member.remarks: You can also override the CacheAttached method to add initialization logic and override the FieldVerifying method to redefine the verification logic for the field value.

member.param: A BQL query that defines the data set that is shown to the user along with the key field that is used as a value. Set to a field (type part of a DAC field) to select all data records from the referenced table. Set to a BQL command of Search type to specify a complex select statement.

Fields to display in the control.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCopyPasteAction`1
member.summary: Implements the copy-paste functionality and creates the Edit button on the page datasource.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCopyPasteHiddenViewAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the cache corresponding to the primary DAC of the data view is not copied when the copy-paste feature is utilized on the webpage.

remarks.para: The attribute is placed on the definition of a data view in a graph to prevent the cache of the first DAC type referenced by the data view to be copied and pasted. The copy-paste feature allows a user to copy all caches related to the graph of the current webpage, add a new data record, and paste all copied caches to the new data record. The PXCopyPasteHiddenView attribute hides a cache from this feature.
To hide only a specific field from the copy-paste feature, use the PXCopyPasteHiddenFields attribute.

member.example:
The code below shows the use of the attribute on the definition of a data view in a graph. As a result, the APAdjust cache is not copied when the user clicks Copy on the webpage bound to the graph where the data view is defined.
[PXCopyPasteHiddenView()] public PXSelectJoin<APAdjust, InnerJoin<APPayment, On<APPayment.docType, Equal<APAdjust.adjgDocType>, And<APPayment.refNbr, Equal<APAdjust.adjgRefNbr>>>>> Adjustments;

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXCopyPasteHiddenViewAttribute.IsHiddenView(PX.Data.PXGraph,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the value indicating whether the attribute is attached to the specified data view in the graph.
member.param: The graph where the data view is defined.
The name of the data view.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCopyPasteHiddenFieldsAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specific fields of the primary DAC of the data view are not copied when the copy-paste feature is utilized on the webpage.
member.remarks: See the PXCopyPasteHiddenView attribute for more detail.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below prevents only the InvoiceNbr field of the APInvoice DAC from copying when a user clicks Copy on the webpage.

code.title: Example2
code.description: Multiple fields can be listed, as the following code shows.

example.code: [PXCopyPasteHiddenFields(typeof(GLTranDoc.parentLineNbr), typeof(GLTranDoc.curyDiscAmt), typeof(GLTranDoc.extRefNbr))] public PXSelect<GLTranDoc, Where<GLTranDoc.module, Equal<Current<GLDocBatch.module>>, And<GLTranDoc.batchNbr, Equal<Current<GLDocBatch.batchNbr>>>>, OrderBy<Asc<GLTranDoc.groupTranID, Asc<GLTranDoc.lineNbr>>>> GLTranModuleBatNbr;

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PXCopyPasteHiddenFields attribute.
member.param: The DAC fields that are not copied when the user utilize the copy-paste feature.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXUIVisibility
member.summary: Is used to define the visibility of input controls.
member.remarks:
This enumeration is used to define the following:
The visibility of an input control or a grid column at runtime
A hint as to which columns you should include in the grid while selecting them in the webpage layout designer
The default set of columns displayed in the pop-up of the PXSelector input control
The set of columns automatically added to the PXGrid control with the AutoGenerateColumns property set to AppendDynamic if no appropriate columns are defined for the PXGrid control

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXUIVisibility.Invisible
member.summary: The field input control or column is hidden.
member.remarks: Also, when you select columns for a grid in the webpage layout designer, the field column is not recommended to be included.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXUIVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The field input control or column is visible.
member.remarks: Also, when you select columns for a grid in the webpage layout designer, the field column is recommended to be included.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXUIVisibility.SelectorVisible
member.summary: The field column is added to the PXSelector lookup control when the PXSelector attribute does not define the set of columns explicitly.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXUIVisibility.Dynamic
member.summary: The field column is automatically added to the PXGrid control if the AutoGenerateColumns property of the grid is set to AppendDynamic.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel
member.summary: This enumeration specifies the level of the PXSetPropertyException exception. Depending on the level, different error or warning signs are attached to UI controls associated with particular fields or rows.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.Undefined
member.summary: The Error sign is attached to the input controls or cells of the DAC fields whose PXFieldStateError property values are not null.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.RowInfo
member.summary: The Information sign is attached to a DAC row within the PXGrid control.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.Warning
member.summary: The Warning sign is attached to a DAC field input control or cell.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.RowWarning
member.summary: The Warning sign is attached to a DAC row within the PXGrid control.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.Error
member.summary: The Error sign is attached to a DAC field input control or a cell.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorLevel.RowError
member.summary: The Error sign is attached to a DAC row within the PXGrid control.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXErrorHandling
member.summary: This enumeration is used in the PXUIField attribute to specify when to handle the PXSetPropertyException exception related to the field. If the exception is handled, the user gets a message box with the error description, and the field input control is marked as causing an error.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorHandling.WhenVisible
member.summary: The exception is reported only when the PXUIField attribute with the Visible property set to true is attached to a DAC field.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorHandling.Always
member.summary: The exception is always reported by the PXUIField attribute attached to a DAC field.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXErrorHandling.Never
member.summary: The exception is never reported by the PXUIField attribute attached to a DAC field.

member.name: M:PX.Data.GenericInquiry.GenericInquiryHelpers.IsTableUsedInSelect(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{PX.Data.Maintenance.GI.GIRelation},PX.Data.Maintenance.GI.GITable)
member.summary: Checks that will be used in Select statement based on configured and
member.param: Alias of the table to be checked
All configured relations
First table in the tables list
member.remarks: There are two cases when a specific table is used in the query: 1. When there are no relations configured in the GI, first table from the tables list is used to select data. 2. When there are some relations configured in the GI, first table from the relations list is used in the FROM statement, then other tables from the relations list are used in the JOIN statements. There is a limitation of the current GI engine that relations should be in the right order, so in some cases table might not be used in the query even if it presents in the relations list. Current implementation checks that is a descendant of the table used in the FROM statement. The following examples show when TableX considered as not used: 1. TableA join TableB, TableC join TableX. There is no relations between TableB and TableC. 2. TableA join TableB, TableX join TableB (A -> B <- X). TableA is not a ancestor of the TableX.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXSubstituteAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the derived DAC should replace its base DACs in a specific graph or all graphs.
member.remarks: The attribute is placed on the definition of a DAC that is derived from another DAC. The attribute is used primarily to make the declarative references of the base DAC in definitions of calculations and links from child objects to parent objects be interpreted as the references of the derived DAC.
member.example:
The code below shows the use of the PXSubstitute attributes on the APInvoice DAC.
[System.SerializableAttribute()] [PXSubstitute(GraphType = typeof(APInvoiceEntry))] [PXSubstitute(GraphType = typeof(TX.TXInvoiceEntry))] [PXPrimaryGraph(typeof(APInvoiceEntry))] public partial class APInvoice : APRegister, IInvoice { ... }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSubstituteAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute. Without explicitly set properties, the attribute will cause all base DACs to be replaced with the derived DAC in all graphs.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSubstituteAttribute.GraphType
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific graph in which the derived DAC replaces base DACs.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXSubstituteAttribute.ParentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the base DAC type up to which all types in the inheritance hierarchy are substituted with the derived DAC. By default, the property has the null value, which means that all base DACs are substituted with the derived DAC.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXBreakInheritanceAttribute
member.summary: When placed on a derived data access class (DAC), indicates that the cache objects corresponding to the base DACs should not be instantiated.
member.example:
In the example below, the attribute prevents instantiation of the INItemStats cache during instantiation of the INItemStatsTotal cache.
[PXBreakInheritance] [Serializable] public partial class INItemStatsTotal : INItemStats { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXGraph

summary.para: The base type that defines the common interface of business logic controllers (graphs), which you should derive from either PXGraph<TGraph> or PXGraph<TGraph, TPrimary>.

Each webpage references a graph (through the PXDatasource control). An instance of this graph is created and destroyed on each user's request, while the modified data records are preserved between requests in the session.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXGraph.IsImport
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the import and export engine is working. That is, the field is true during the submission or retrieval of data with the import scenarios, the export scenarios, the web services API, the copy-and-paste functionality, or the mobile application.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXGraph.IsExport
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the export engine is working. That is, the field is true during the retrieval of data with the export scenarios, the web services API, the copy-and-paste functionality, or the mobile application.

remarks.para: During the data export, the field is true as well. Therefore, you need to check the following conditions to check which operation is performed:

list.item: If you need to check that the data export is performed: (graph.IsImport && graph.IsExport)
If you need to check that the data import is performed: (graph.IsImport && !graph.IsExport)
If you need to check that either the data import or the data export is performed: (graph.IsImport)

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXGraph.Persist
member.summary: Saves the modified data records kept in the caches to the database.

remarks.para: All data records are saved within a single transaction context. The method takes into account only the caches from the Views.Caches collection.
The method divides the caches into two groups:

list.item: Caches that store records of DACs that either are not marked with the attribute (or its descendant), or whose attribute has the PersistOrder property not equal to PersistOrder.AtTheEndOfTransaction.
Caches that store records of DACs whose attribute has the PersistOrder property equal to PersistOrder.AtTheEndOfTransaction.

remarks.para: Then the method saves the data records (first from the first group, then from the second) in the following order:

list.item: Data records with the Inserted status from all caches.
Data records with the Updated status from all caches
Data records with the Deleted status from all caches

remarks.para: The application does not typically saves the changes through this method directly. The preferred way of saving the changes to the database is to execute Actions.PressSave() on the graph. The PressSave() method of the Actions collection invokes the Persist() method on the graph and performs additional procedures.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXGraph`1
member.summary: The type that is used to derive business logic controllers (graphs) in the application. This type extends the PXGraph type with the ability to automatically initialize data views, actions, and event handlers that are defined as members in the current graph or in its base graphs.

remarks.para: This type extends the PXGraph type with the ability to automatically initialize data views, actions, and event handlers that are defined as members in the current graph or in its base graphs.
In a graph, you can define the following members:

item.description: Data views as objects of the PXSelect<> type or its variant. The type of a data view is the BQL expression which can be executed by invoking the Select() or Search() methods.
Actions as objects of the PXAction type and paired by the implementation method.
Event handlers.

remarks.para: For a data view you can also define the optional method that will be executed by the Select() method to retrieve the data instead of the standard logic of retreiving the data.

Data views and actions must be declared as public. When you declare data views and actions, you do not initialize them. The graph initializes them automatically. The PXView objects initialized by the data views are available through the Views collection of the graph. The actions are available through the Actions collection of the graph.

Event handlers and methods can be declared as public, protected, or internal. The protected virtual is the recommended modifier. Event handlers of particular type are available through the corresponding collections.
You can derive a graph from the PXGraph<TGraph, TPrimary> type to add pre-defined actions to the graph.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below declares a graph.

code.title: Example2
code.description: The type parameter is set to the graph itself. The code below declares a graph with a data view, an action, and an event handler.

summary.para: The same as PXGraph<TGraph> but appends the following standard actions for the provided DAC:
The DAC is specified in the second type parameter.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below declares a graph that includes a pre-defined set of actions for the Contact DAC. If a webpage is bound to this graph, the webpage toolbar will include the action buttons, which may be used to save, insert, delete, and navigate to Contact data records selected by the primary data view (the data view defined first).

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXGraph`2.Save
member.summary: The action that saves changes stored in the caches to the database. The code of an application graph typically saves changes through this action as well. To invoke it from code, use the PressSave() method of the Actions property.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXOverrideAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method defined in a graph extension overrides a virtual method defined in the graph.
member.remarks: The attribute is placed on the declaration of a method in a graph extension. (The graph extension is a class that derives from the PXGraphExtension generic class, where the type parameter is set to the graph to extend.) As a result, the method overrides the graph method with the same signature. That is, the method is executed instead of the graph method whenever the graph method is invoked.

summary.para: You use the PXMergeAttributes attribute to specify for each field how to apply custom attributes to the existing ones in a DAC extension.

code.title: Example
code.description: For example, suppose that for the customized FieldName field, you have to add the PXDefault attribute and change the value in the PXUIFieldAttribute. Suppose the original code of the FieldName field is the following.

example.code: #region FieldName ... [PXDBDecimal(2)] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Display Name")] public virtual decimal? FieldName {...} #endregion

code.title: Example2
code.description: In the DAC extension code for the customized field, specify the Merge option, as shown below.

code.title: Example3
code.description: The system will merge attributes for the FieldName field. In the result of the merge, the FieldName field will have the following collection of attributes.

example.code: ... [PXDBDecimal(2)] [PXDefault(TypeCode.Decimal, "0.0")] [PXUIField(DisplayName = "Name")] public virtual decimal? FieldName {...}

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXMergeAttributesAttribute.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets a merge method that was selected in the MergeMethod enumeration.

member.name: T:PX.Data.MergeMethod
member.summary: Defines the ways attributes of the DAC and the DAC extension are merged. The enumeration is used in the PXMergeAttributes attribute.

member.name: F:PX.Data.MergeMethod.Append
member.summary: Is used to add custom attributes to the existing ones.

member.name: F:PX.Data.MergeMethod.Replace
member.summary: Forces the system to use custom attributes instead of the existing ones. This option is used by default if you do not specify the PXMergeAttributes attribute on the customized field.

member.name: F:PX.Data.MergeMethod.Merge
member.summary: Makes the system apply the union of the custom and existing attributes to the customized field.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCustomizeBaseAttributeAttribute
member.summary: The PXCustomizeBaseAttribute attribute is added to the field in a DAC extension for each modified parameter.

code.title: Example
code.description: For example, to set the Enabled parameter of the PXUIField attribute of a field to false, add the following attribute to the field region of the DAC extension.

example.code: [PXCustomizeBaseAttribute(typeof(PXUIFieldAttribute), "Enabled", false)]

code.title: Example2
code.description: The following example shows how to change the Required parameter of the PXUIField attribute for the MyField field of the MyDAC data access class in the MyGraph graph extension by using the CacheAttached() event handler.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCustomizeBaseAttributeAttribute.TargetAttribute
member.summary: Gets the target attribute.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCustomizeBaseAttributeAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets a property name.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXCustomizeBaseAttributeAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets the value.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXCustomizeSelectorColumns
member.summary: This attribute defines a new set and order of the columns in the specified selector. You use this attribute in a DAC extension.

code.title: Example
code.description: For example, suppose that you have to add a new column to the ItemClassID selector, which is located on the General Settings tab of the Stock Items form. The original attributes of the field are the following.

code.title: Example2
code.description: The ItemClassID selector contains two columns for the INItemClass.itemClassID and INItemClass.descr fields. The code below shows how to customize only the PXSelector attribute of the field if you need to insert a new column for the INItemClass.baseUnit field between the existing columns. The system will append attributes for the ItemClassID field because of the Append method in the PXMergeAttibutes specified in the DAC extension. In the result of the specified merge method, the ItemClassID field has all original attributes, and the PXCustomizeSelectorColumns attribute is added through the DAC extension. The selector control of the ItemClassID field has three columns, as specified in the PXCustomizeSelectorColumns attribute.

example.code: public class IN_InventoryItem_Extension: PXCacheExtension<PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem> { #region ItemClassID [PXMergeAttributes(Method = MergeMethod.Append)] [PXCustomizeSelectorColumns( typeof(PX.Objects.IN.INItemClass.itemClassID), typeof(PX.Objects.IN.INItemClass.baseUnit), typeof(PX.Objects.IN.INItemClass.descr))] #endregion }

summary.para: The PXRemoveBaseAttribute attribute removes the specified attribute. You use this attribute in a DAC extension.

code.title: Example
code.description: For example, to remove the PXUIField attribute of the field, add the following attribute to the field region of the DAC extension.

example.code: [PXRemoveBaseAttribute(typeof(PXUIFieldAttribute))]

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXRemoveBaseAttributeAttribute.TargetAttribute
member.summary: The attribute to be removed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXRemoveBaseAttributeAttribute.ExactType
member.summary: If set to false, all the attributes derived from , including the one which is itself, are removed. Otherwise only the attribute of exact type is removed.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectBase`1.Ask(System.String,System.String,System.String,PX.Data.MessageButtons,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays the dialog box (PXSmartPanel) with one or more choices for the user. The data for the dialog box can be read from the server or the cache.
member.param: The identifier of the dialog box (PXSmartPanel).
Dialog box caption.
The message to display in the dialog box.
A MessageButtons value indicating the set of buttons to display in the dialog box.
If true, the data for the dialog box is read from the server, and some or all controls of the form are refreshed. If false, the data for the dialog box is first searched in the cache.
member.returns: The WebDialogResult value that indicates the clicked button.

remarks.para: This method and its overloads provide the interface for the corresponding methods of the PXView class.

The method can be used to display the panel configured by the PXSmartPanel control. In this case, the key parameter is set to the Key property of the control, refreshRequired is typically set to true, and other parameters are set to null. The more common way to display a panel is to call the AskExt(key) method.

Note that the method is executed asynchronously. When the method invocation is reached for the first time, execution of the enclosing method stops, and a request is send to the client to display the dialog. When the user clicks one of the buttons, the webpage sends a request to the server, and the system starts execution of the method that invoked Ask() one more time. This time the Ask() method returns the value that indicates the user's choice, and code execution continues.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below defines an event handler that asks for confirmation to continue deletion of a data record.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectBase`1.Insert
member.summary: Inserts a new data record into the cache by invoking the Insert() method on the cache. Returns the inserted data record or null-if the insertion fails.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectBase`1.Insert(`0)
member.summary: Inserts the provided data record into the cache by invoking the Insert(object) method on the cache. Returns the inserted data record or null-if the insertion fails.
member.param: The data record to insert.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXSelectBase`1.Extend``1(``0)
member.summary: Initializes a data record of the derived DAC from the provided data record of the base DAC and inserts the new data record into the cache. Returns the inserted data record.
member.param: The instance of the base DAC.
member.remarks: The method relies on the Extend<Parent>(Parent) method called on the cache.

code.title: Example
code.description: Suppose that the B DAC derives from the A DAC, as follows.

code.title: Example2
code.description: The following data views can be declared in a graph.

example.code: PXSelect<A> BaseRecords; PXSelect<B> Records;

code.title: Example3
code.description: The code above will result in initialization of two caches, of PXCache<A> and PXCache<B> types. The following code initializes a data record of derived type and inserts it into the cache.

example.code: A baseRec = BaseRecords.Insert(); B rec = Records.Extend<B>(baseRec);

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXSelect`1

summary.para: Defines a data view for retrieving a particular data set from the database and provides the interface to the cache for inserting, updating, and deleting the data records.
This class and other classes derived from PXSelectBase are used as a basis for building BQL statements. These classes are translated into the SQL SELECT statements.

member.typeparam: Specifies a data access class (DAC) bound to a database table from which the resulting SQL query will select records.

remarks.para: A PXSelect<Table> object wraps the Select<Table> object, which represents the BQL command, and the PXView object, which executes this BQL command. The PXSelect<Table> object also holds the reference of the cache of the Table data records and the graph.

The PXSelect<Table> type provides interfaces to the PXView object and the cache. So you can execute the underlying BQL command and invoke cache methods through the methods of the PXSelect<Table> class.

code.title: Example
code.description: The code below shows the declaration of a data view in a graph and execution of this data view.

member.param: The graph with which the data view is associated.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a data view that is bound to the specified graph and uses the provided method to retrieve data.
member.param: The graph with which the data view is associated.
The delegate of the method that is used to retrieve the data from the database (or other source). This method is invoked when one of the Select() methods is called.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXProtectedAccessAttribute

summary.para: Allows to make a protected member of a graph available to be called in a graph extension.

To be able to call a protected member in a graph extension, annotate the member in a graph extension with the PXProtectedAccess attribute. The member has to have the same signature as the corresponding member in the graph or lower-level graph extension. The framework will replace the body of the member annotated with PXProtectedAccess with the body of the corresponding member in the graph or lower-level graph extension.

member.remarks: The member you want to access and the graph extension must be declared abstract.

code.title: Graph Example
code.description: Suppose that the code of Acumatica ERP includes the following graph.

code.title: Graph Extension Example
code.description: You can use the members in an extension of the graph, as shown in the following example.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ISortOrder
member.summary: The interface that the DAC that corresponds to the rows of a grid must implement to make it possible for the PXOrderedSelectBase-derived classes to enumerate and reorder the rows in the grid.
member.remarks: A PXOrderedSelectBase-derived class should be used in a graph for the grid's view.

member.name: P:PX.Data.ISortOrder.SortOrder
member.summary: The order of a row in the grid.

value.para: To persist the order of rows in a grid, the SortOrder property of the DAC that implements the ISortOrder interface must be mapped to the corresponding database column in the DAC's database table. This column stores the order of rows.

The SortOrder number for a new row is defaulted by PXSelectOrderBase, therefore you don't need any attributes on the SortOrder field to default it. By default, the value of SortOrder for a new row is taken from its LineNbr field. However, there is a possibility to define the action on the screen that will insert new row in the middle of a grid and renumber all rows after it.

member.name: P:PX.Data.ISortOrder.LineNbr
member.summary: The line number of a row in the grid.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXRedirectRequiredException
member.summary: Opens the specified application page in either the same window or a new one.
member.remarks: By default, the user is redirected in the same window.

code.title: Example
code.description: In the action handler, you create a new instance of the ProductMaint graph that is the controller for the product editing page. In the graph, you set the Current property of the Product cache to the product if it is found by the specified ID. If the current data record is set for the cache object, you throw the PXRedirectRequiredException to open the page with the current data record displayed.

member.summary: Contains strings for exceptions that can be thrown in Acumatica Platform. These strings are automatically collected during the localization process and can be translated to desired languages.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXMessages
member.summary: Saves messages declared in derived class into internal dictionary and performs search of specific message when it is required. Also calls localization method (from PXLocalizer class) if the message is found which retrieves localized string from dictionary. Each message is stored by the PXMessages class as a triplet in which human-readable message is a key, fully qualified name of message and message number (generated automatically) are value. For example, {No idfield found: {CountryIdFieldNotFound, 24}}. Here, "No idfield found" is a culture-independent human-readable message (key), "PX_Data_ErrorMessages_CountryIdFieldNotFound" is a fully qualified name of message in PXMessages-derived class (which will be used as a key for string in resource-file), "24" is a mesage number (in order of declaration inside of derived class).

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXPrimaryGraphAttribute
member.summary: Sets the primary graph for a DAC. The primary graph determines the default page where a user is redirected for editing a data record.

remarks.para: The attribute can be placed on the following declarations:

item.description: On a DAC—To specify the primary graph for this DAC.
On a DAC extension—To add or override the specification of the primary graph for the DAC.

On a graph—To indicate that it is the primary graph for the specified DACs. This declaration has a higher priority than that on a DAC or a DAC extension. Do not specify the same DAC for different graphs because the behaviour will be unpredictable.
On a graph extension—To add or override the default navigation declared on the graph corresponding to the graph extension.

remarks.para: A declaration of this attribute on a higher level extension overrides the declarations of this attribute on DACs (graphs) or their extensions of lower level.

For a DAC or a DAC extension, you can specify several graphs and corresponding conditions. In this case, the first graph for which the corresponding condition holds true at run time is considered the primary graph. A condition is a BQL query based on either the Where class or the Select class.

code.title: Example
code.description: In the example below, the SalesPersonMaint graph is set as the primary graph for the DAC SalesPerson.

code.title: Example2
code.description: In the example below, the attribute specifies the graph that is used as the primary graph for a DAC if the condition holds true for the data in the cache.

code.title: Example3
code.description: In the example below, the attribute specifies the graph that is used as the primary graph for a DAC if the Select statement retrieves a non-empty data set.

code.title: Example4
code.description: In the example below, the attribute specifies two graphs and the corresponding Select statements. The first graph for which the Select statement returns a non-empty data set is used as the primary graph for the DAC.

code.title: Example5
code.description: In the example below, the attribute defines or redefines the primary graph for the DAC that corresponds to the DAC extension.

code.title: Example6
code.description: In the example below, the attribute of the graph specifies the DAC for which the graph is used as the primary graph when the Select statement returns a non-empty data set.

code.title: Example7
code.description: In the example below, the attribute defines the graph that corresponds to the graph extension as the primary graph for the DAC. This definition has the highest priority over other definitions of the primary graph.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXPrimaryGraphAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: For a DAC, the attribute specifies a graph that will be used to edit DAC's records. For a graph, the attribute specifies a DAC whose records will be edited by the graph.
member.param: The business logic controller (graph) or the DAC. The graph should derive from PXGraph. The DAC should implement IBqlTable.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXPrimaryGraphAttribute.#ctor(System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.param: The array of business logic controllers (graphs) or DACs. A graph should derive from PXGraph. A DAC should implement IBqlTable.
The array of conditions that correspond to the graphs or DACs specified in the first parameter. Specify BQL queries, either Where expressions or Select commands.
member.example:
In the example below, the attribute specifies the graph that is used as the primary graph for a DAC if the condition holds true for the data in the cache.
[PXPrimaryGraph( new Type[] { typeof(ShipTermsMaint)}, new Type[] { typeof(Select<ShipTerms, Where<ShipTerms.shipTermsID, Equal<Current<ShipTerms.shipTermsID>>>>) })] public partial class ShipTerms : PX.Data.IBqlTable { ... }

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXImportAttribute
member.summary: Adds the table toobar button that allows the user to load data from a file to the table. The attribute is placed on the view that is used to obtain the data for the table.

remarks.para: The attribute is placed on the view declaration in the graph. As a result, the table that uses the view as a data provider will include the button that opens the data import wizard. By using this wizard, a user can load data from an Excel or CSV file to the table.
You can control all steps of the data import if you make the graph implement the PXImportAttribute.IPXPrepareItems interface.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXLineNbrAttribute
member.summary: Automatically generates unique line numbers that identify for child data records in the parent-child relationship. This attribute does not work without the PXParent attribute.

remarks.para: The attribute should be placed on the child DAC field that stores the line number. The line number is a two-byte integer incremented by the IncrementStep property value, which equals 1 by default. The line number uniquely identifies a data record among the child data records related to a given parent data record. The attribute calculates each next value by incrementing the current number of the child data records.

The child DAC field to store the line number typically has the short? data type. It also should be a key field. You indicate that the field is a key field by setting the IsKey property of the data type attribute to true.

As a parameter, you should pass either the parent DAC field that stores the number of related child data records or the parent DAC itself. In the latter case, the attribute will determine the number of related child data records by itself. If the parent DAC field is specified, the attribute automatically updates its value.

code.title: Example
code.description: The attribute below takes the number of related child data records from the provided parent field. The PXParent attribute must be added to some other field of this DAC.

code.title: Example2
code.description: In the following example, the attribute calculates the number of related child data records by itself.

example.code: [PXDBShort(IsKey = true)] [PXLineNbr(typeof(Vendor))] [PXParent(typeof( Select<Vendor, Where<Vendor.bAccountID, Equal<Current<TaxReportLine.vendorID>>>>))] public virtual short? LineNbr { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXLineNbrAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute. As a parameter you can provide the parent data record field that stores the number of child data records or the parent DAC if there is no such field. In the latter case the attribute will calculate the number of child data records automatically.
member.param: The parent data record field that stores the number of children or the parent DAC.
Allows to make field editable.
member.example:
In the following example, the attribute calculates the number of related child data records by itself.
[PXDBShort(IsKey = true)] [PXLineNbr(typeof(Vendor))] [PXParent(typeof( Select<Vendor, Where<Vendor.bAccountID, Equal<Current<TaxReportLine.vendorID>>>>))] public virtual short? LineNbr { get; set; }

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXLineNbrAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute. As a parameter you can provide the parent data record field that stores the number of child data records or the parent DAC if there is no such field. In the latter case the attribute will calculate the number of child data records automatically.
member.param: The parent data record field that stores the number of children or the parent DAC.
Allows to make field editable.
member.example:
In the following example, the attribute calculates the number of related child data records by itself.
[PXDBShort(IsKey = true)] [PXLineNbr(typeof(Vendor))] [PXParent(typeof( Select<Vendor, Where<Vendor.bAccountID, Equal<Current<TaxReportLine.vendorID>>>>))] public virtual short? LineNbr { get; set; }

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXLineNbrAttribute.IncrementStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the number by which the line number is incremented or decremented. By default, the property equals 1.

member.summary: Indicates whether the source field would be decremented on the row deleting or not. By default, the property equals true.

member.summary: Indicates whether the line number gaps produced by the delete operation should be reused

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXParallelProcessingOptions
member.summary: The parallel processing options that override the default ones and the ones from the web.config file.

remarks.para: To enable parallel processing in the system, you need to set the ParallelProcessingDisabled key to in the appSettings section of the web.config file. You can additionally set the values of the following keys:

list.item: ParallelProcessingBatchSize: You specify the number of records that are included in a batch for parallel processing. By default, the value is 10. You can override this value in code.

EnableAutoNumberingInSeparateConnection: You set the key to true to make the system issue new document numbers in a separate connection to the NumberingSequence table, which means that the numbering sequence does not blocks other threads that are running in parallel. You cannot override this value in code.
Note: If a thread fails to process a batch, the numbering sequence may have gaps in the numbering sequence.

ParallelProcessingMaxThreads: Specify the maximum number of parallel threads that are used by the processing delegates. You cannot override this value in code.
Tip: The system calculates the number of cores that are used for parallel processing depending on the license parameters and the actual number of cores available on the machine. The value of the key can additionally decrease the number of threads available for parallel processing.

IsParallelProcessingSkipBatchExceptions: Set the key to true to make the system continue with processing of other batches if an exception occurs during processing of a batch. The error is still recorded and, if you use a parallel processing via a processing view, the exception is thrown after the processing of all batches. If you use the PXProcessing.ProcessItemsParallel method directly, you can handle the errors by yourself. However, if the initial exception is exception, which is a system exception, the batch is marked as processed incorrectly regardless of the value of the key. You cannot override the value of this key in code.

code.title: Example
code.description: To configure the parallel execution for a particular processing view, you need to set ParallelProcessingOptions of the processing view, as shown in the example below.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXParallelProcessingOptions.IsEnabled
member.summary: A field that specifies (if set to ) that parallel processing is enabled for a particular processing.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXParallelProcessingOptions.BatchSize
member.summary: The batch size for parallel processing.
member.remarks: You override this field if you need to use a custom batch size for this parallel processing.

member.name: F:PX.Data.PXParallelProcessingOptions.SplitToBatches
member.summary: A delegate for custom batch splitting.
member.remarks: If the SplitToBatches delegate is not , it is used instead of the algorithm of the original PX.Data.PXBatchList.SplitToBatches function.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following code shows an example of the SplitToBatches delegate. The ScheduledTran rows are ordered by the key, which consists of the following fields: ScheduleID, ComponentID, and DetailLineNbr. The customized SplitToBatches delegate corrects the batch size if the ScheduledTran rows with the same parent key are split to multiple batches. The correction of the batch size is necessary because the process updates the parent object of the rows (which is DRScheduleDetail) and has to do it only once.

member.summary: You use this method to add properties that you want to be returned in push notifications.
member.remarks: The Enrich() method is called in the PX.Data.PXTransactionScope.Dispose() method. Therefore, the Enrich() method must not return data that is not accessible in this scope.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following code shows a sample implementation of the ICommitEventEnricher interface, which adds the business date and the name of the user to the AdditionalInfo element of notifications in JSON format.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PushNotifications.Statistics.IQueueDispatcherWithStatusInfo.Type
member.summary: Have to be 2 characters long (to fit nchar(2) column in database)

member.name: M:PX.Data.PushNotifications.Statistics.IQueueDispatcherWithStatusInfo.DoMaintenanceWork(System.Action)
member.summary: This method stops the dispatcher, invoke action, after completion starts dispatcher

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXFieldScope
member.summary: This class allows you to restrict the set of fields on which the SELECT operation will be performed to speed up this operation.
member.remarks: No RowSelecting event (for example, originated from attributes) will be generated for the fields that are not specified in the PXFieldScope constructor.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.Fields
member.summary: The set of fields on which the SELECT operations are performed.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.View
member.summary: The PXView object that contains the fields on which the SELECT operations are performed.
member.remarks: The RestrictedFields property of this view contains the fields specified in the constructor of the PXFieldScope object. When the Dispose method is called, the RestrictedFields property of the view is cleared of these fields.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.#ctor(PX.Data.PXView,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a PXFieldScope object.
member.param: The PXView object to store the fields on which the SELECT operations will be performed.
The fields explicitly specified here and the fields from the tables specified here constitute the set of fields on which the SELECT operations will be performed.
Specifies whether the fields that are dependent on the explicitly listed fields must be taken into account too.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.#ctor(PX.Data.PXView,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a PXFieldScope object.
member.param: The PXView object to store the fields on which the SELECT operations will be performed.
The fields on which to perform the SELECT operations.
Specifies whether the fields that are dependent on the explicitly listed fields must be taken into account too.

member.name: M:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.#ctor(PX.Data.PXView,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{PX.Data.RestrictedField},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a PXFieldScope object.
member.param: The PXView object to store the fields on which the SELECT operations will be performed.
The fields on which to perform the SELECT operations.
Specifies whether the fields that are dependent on the explicitly listed fields must be taken into account too.

member.name: P:PX.Data.PXFieldScope.IsScoped
member.summary: Returns true if a fields scope for the SELECT operation is set; otherwise, it returns false.

member.name: T:PX.Data.RestrictedField
member.summary: This class represents an item of a fields set used by the PXFieldScope class.

member.name: P:PX.Data.RestrictedField.Table
member.summary: Returns the table to which the field belongs.

member.name: P:PX.Data.RestrictedField.Field
member.summary: Returns the field name.

member.name: T:PX.Data.RestrictedFieldsSet
member.summary: This class represents a set of fields (RestrictedField objects) used by the PXFieldScope class.

member.name: M:PX.Data.RestrictedFieldsSet.Any
member.summary: Indicates whether the fields set contains any items.
member.returns: Returns true if the RestrictedFieldsSet object contains any items; otherwise, the method returns false.

member.name: P:PX.Data.RestrictedFieldsSet.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the RestrictedFieldsSet object.

member.name: T:PX.Data.PXLogFieldToTelemetryAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a DAC property's value is stored by telemetry as the property of a request. The attribute is assigned to a DAC property.
member.remarks: For primary items of a graph, their keys are stored in the telemetry property of an HTTP request. However for instance, if a graph has a data view, the keys of the corresponding DAC are not stored in telemetry. If you need to store these keys in telemetry, you can mark the respective properties of the 's type argument (that is, of the DAC) with PXLogFieldToTelemetryAttribute.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXExcludeRowsFromReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute
member.summary:
Excludes certain rows of child- from referential integrity check by using the and .
Child- can has many parent-specific conditions, and only one general condition (where is no set).
To include s in referential integrity check declare a by using one of the following attributes: or (on child side), or (on parent or child side).

member.name: P:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXExcludeRowsFromReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates whether attribute has a valid configuration

member.name: P:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXExcludeRowsFromReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute.CurrentTableExcludingCondition
member.summary: Condition (-clause) that determines if a certain row should be excluded from referential integrity check based on the row itself

member.name: P:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXExcludeRowsFromReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute.ForeignTableExcludingConditions
member.summary:
Represents a single or a set of excluding conditions (-clauses) targeted on external , that left-joined to the row by the defined -expression.
If any of conditions is met for a certain row - it would be excluded from referential integrity check.
Should be a single a or a type specification, or an filled with such types.

member.name: P:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXExcludeRowsFromReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute.SpecificParent
member.summary:
The only parent- for which the passed conditions are meaningful to.
If is set, the conditions become specific excluding conditions, otherwise, if is null, the conditions become general excluding conditions that are meaningful to any parent-
General and specific conditions (if both) are combined with -clause on referential integrity check.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludingConditionArray
member.summary: A of types (i.e. or ).

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1
member.summary: Begins a foreign table excluding condition definition by defining the foreign .

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.Joined`1
member.summary: Continues the foreign table excluding condition definition by defining -condition, on which foreign would be joined to the current table.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.Joined`1.Satisfies`1
member.summary: Finishes the foreign table excluding condition definition by defining the -condition, which foreign should match so that a current table row would be excluded from referential integrity check.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.Joined`1.JoinOnly
member.summary:
Finishes the foreign table excluding condition definition by indicating that foreign table should only be joined without any excluding condition introducing and that real excluding condition for joined table will be found in further foreign table excluding condition definitions, therefore such excluding condition should never be neither the last element of , nor the single condition.
Using of current technique allows developer to define complex excluding conditions, that includes fields of multiple tables.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.JoinedAsParent
member.summary: Continues the foreign table excluding condition definition by indicating that -condition, on which foreign would be joined to the current table, should be searched in s of current table.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.JoinedAsParent.Satisfies`1
member.summary: Finishes the foreign table excluding condition definition by defining the -condition, which foreign should match so that a current table row would be excluded from referential integrity check.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.ExcludeWhen`1.JoinedAsParent.JoinOnly
member.summary:
Finishes the foreign table excluding condition definition by indicating that foreign table should only be joined without any excluding condition introducing and that real excluding condition for joined table will be found in further foreign table excluding condition definitions, therefore such excluding condition should never be neither the last element of , nor the single condition.
Using of current technique allows developer to define complex excluding conditions, that includes fields of multiple tables.

member.name: T:PX.Data.ReferentialIntegrity.Attributes.PXReferentialIntegrityCheckAttribute
member.summary:
Passively includes targeted in referential integrity check without creating any s.
s could be declared explicitly by using (on child side).
Certain rows could be excluded from referential integrity check by using .
In case when only parent- is included in referential integrity check, only children presence checking will be performed on parent-row deleting.
In case when only child- is included in referential integrity check, only parent presence checking will be performed on child-row inserting.
In case when both child- and parent- are included in referential integrity check, both checks will be performed on corresponding events.

member.name: M:PX.Data.SQLTree.Query.CreateOptimizedListInclusionCheck(PX.Data.SQLTree.SQLExpression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates expression to check if the value included in the elements.
member.param: Column to be checked
List of values
member.remarks: As recursion is used while transforming IN to SQL query, it fails with StackOverflowException on large amount of elements. So we have to avoid using IN in such a case. If the contains more than elements, BETWEEN will be used instead of simple WHERE IN clause. In that case it will split the source to sequential chunks and use its minimal and maximal values in the BETWEEN clause. To avoid StackOverflowException during multiple OR processing, several expressions grouped into clusters with elements and embraced. For example, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] will be converted to "column BETWEEN 1 AND 5", [1, 2, ..., 24, 25, 27, 28, ..., 44, 45] will be converted to "column BETWEEN 1 AND 25 OR column BETWEEN 27 AND 45" [1, 2, ..., 24, 25, 27, 29, ..., 44, 45] will be converted to "column BETWEEN 1 AND 25 OR column = 27 OR column BETWEEN 29 AND 45"

member.name: T:PX.Data.Webhooks.IWebhookHandler
member.summary: The interface that you need to implement to expose webhooks out of Acumatica ERP for external applications.

remarks.para: Acumatica ERP provides webhooks as a way to integrate external applications that provide data in their own format and need to submit this data to Acumatica ERP. For example, HubSpot collects data about email clicks and can export this data in a specific format to a particular URL. With the webhooks, a developer can configure Acumatica ERP to process the data submitted to a particular URL and save the data in Acumatica ERP.

To process data from an external application in Acumatica ERP with webhooks, you need to create a class that implements the IWebhookHandler interface. For more convenient implementation, we recommend that you implement this interface in a graph (that is, a class of the type).
You need to place a DLL file with the implementation class in the Bin folder of the Acumatica ERP instance.

member.name: M:PX.Data.Webhooks.IWebhookHandler.ProcessRequestAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Processes the requests from an external application.
member.param: The HTTP request message that has been sent to Acumatica ERP.
A cancellation token to cancel the operation.

remarks.para: In this method, the developer needs to process a request from an external application, including the following:

list.item: Process authentication information in the request
Transform the data in external format to the data that can be saved in Acumatica ERP
Invoke graph methods that save the data in Acumatica ERP

member.returns: The result of processing of the request, such as System.Web.Http.Results.OkResult.

member.name: T:PX.SM.Users
member.summary: Represents a user account to access Acumatica ERP.
member.remarks: To access Acumatica ERP, an individual must have a user account in the system and a user role assigned to the account. Then based on their roles, users may access only the resources and perform only the actions they are authorized to. The records of this type are created and edited on the Users (SM201010) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory
member.summary: The DAC that works with the tracking history. The tracking history contains tracking points. The system saves tracking points only for active (=true) tracking requests.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory.TrackingID
member.summary: The identifier of the tracking request, which allows to match the tracking point with the details of the tracking request, such as the user name and the device name.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory.ExecutionDate
member.summary: The date and time when the tracking point was recorded.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the tracking point.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the tracking point.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingHistory.Altitude
member.summary: The altitude of the tracking point.

member.name: T:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest
member.summary: A DAC that is used to set up GPS tracking of a mobile client.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.RequestID
member.summary: An auto-generated unique key of the GPS tracking request.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.Description
member.summary: A description of the GPS tracking request. The property is used to display a description of the GPS tracking request in the UI.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.IsActive
member.summary: A Boolean flag that indicates (if set to true) that the GPS tracking is active for this tracking request and the system writes the tracking history for this request.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.TrackingID
member.summary: An auto-generated unique identifier, which is saved in the DAC.
member.value: You can replace the auto-generated tracking ID with the tracking ID of another tracking request. In this case, these tracking request will have the same tracking ID in the tracking history. You may need to use this approach, for example, to create two tracking requests for one user to handle the lunch break of the user.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.UserName
member.summary: The login of a user in Acumatica ERP.
member.value: You specify the login without the tenant name. If the value is not specified, the system accepts tracking requests from the mobile devices on which any user is signed in.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.DeviceID
member.summary: The device ID of the mobile device.
member.value: If the value is an empty string, the system accepts tracking requests from devices with any device ID.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.DeviceName
member.summary: The device name of the mobile device.
member.value: If the value is an empty string, the system accepts tracking requests from devices with any name.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.TimeZoneID
member.summary: The ID of the time zone in which the , , , are specified.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.WeeklyOnDay1
member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Sunday.

member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Monday.

member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Tuesday.

member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Wednesday.

member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Thursday.

member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies (if set to false) that the mobile device does not report tracking points on Friday.

member.name: P:PX.FS.FSGPSTrackingRequest.WeeklyOnDay7

member.name: M:PX.Caching.ContainerBuilderExtensions.RegisterVersionedCacheControl``1(Autofac.ContainerBuilder)

summary.para: Registers a new Cache Control implementation that utilizes cache versioning for cache invalidation.
After the registration, it can be resolved either as or . Additionally, if is derived from , it can also be resolved as (but be aware that it always returns a single instance).
Make sure that your cache utilizes either directly or by using as a part of the key.

member.typeparam: A marker type used to distinguish different caches.

code.title: Example
code.description: In the example below, the versioned cache control is registered using a marker type

example.code: builder.RegisterVersionedCacheControl<PXSiteMap.ScreenInfo>();

code.title: Example2
code.description: In the example below, the versioned cache control is registered using a VersionedCacheControl<TCacheName> inheritor that can be explicitly resolved later

member.name: T:PX.Caching.VersionedCacheControl`1

summary.para: A Cache Control implementation that utilizes cache versioning for cache invalidation.
Can be used as a base class for a type that can be used as a during the registration, e.g. class FooCacheControl : VersionedCacheControl<FooCacheControl>
Use extension method on to register your derived type in DI to be able to resolve it either explicitly (i.e., as FooCacheControl) or as or .

member.typeparam: A marker type used to distinguish different caches.

summary.para: An interface that is used to execute a long-running operation, such as processing data or releasing a document, asynchronously in a separate thread. This interface manages the threads created on the Acumatica ERP server to process long-running operations.

summary.para: From the custom information dictionary of the current long-running operation, returns the data object that is stored under the specified key. If the value is null or empty, the method returns the data object that is stored under the default key.

member.name: M:PX.Concurrency.ILongOperationManager.GetCustomInfoFor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[]@)

summary.para: From the custom information dictionary of the long-running operation specified by the parameter, returns the data object that is stored under the key specified in the parameter. In the parameter, this method returns the list of the records processed by the delegate of the long-running operation. If the PXLongOperation static class does not contain a long-running operation with the key specified in the parameter, the method returns null. Otherwise, the method does the following:
summary.list:
If the parameter is null or empty: Returns the data object that is stored under the default key
Otherwise: Returns the data object that is stored under the key specified in the parameter

member.param: The ID of the long-running operation.
The key to access the data object in the custom information dictionary of the long-running operation specified by the first parameter.
The out parameter that is used to return the array of the data records that must be processed by the delegate of the long-running operation.

member.name: M:PX.Concurrency.ILongOperationManager.SetCustomInfo(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: In the custom information dictionary of the current long-running operation, stores the data object, which is specified in the parameter, under the key that is defined by the parameter.
member.param: The data object to be stored in the dictionary.
The key to store and access in the dictionary the data object that is specified in the first parameter.

summary.para: Returns the collection of objects, which contain information about the long-running operations that are in progress. The information includes the name of the user that started the operation, the form on which the operation was started, the progress of the operation, the number of errors, and the time the operation has been processing.

member.name: T:PX.TM.EPCompanyTreeMaster
member.summary: Represents a workgroup in the company tree (a hierarchy of workgroups).
member.remarks: Company tree is a model of your organization's hierarchy that includes temporary and permanent workgroups. The company tree may reflect the administrative hierarchy and include sub-hierarchies of workgroups created within specific branches or departments. The company tree is used for creating assignment rules in approval and assignment maps and for determining the scope of the users who want to view items assigned to them. The records of this type are created and edited on the Company Tree (EP204061) form, which corresponds to the graph, and imported on the Import Company Tree (EP204060) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.TM.EPCompanyTreeH
member.summary: Represents a heirarchy record of the workgroup in the company tree.
member.remarks: Company tree is a model of your organization's hierarchy that includes temporary and permanent workgroups. The company tree may reflect the administrative hierarchy and include sub-hierarchies of workgroups created within specific branches or departments. The company tree is used for creating assignment rules in approval and assignment maps and for determining the scope of the users who want to view items assigned to them. summary.para: Provides in-memory -based implementation of and interfaces.

member.remarks: Made for unit test purposes only.

member.name: T:PX.Metadata.IScreenInfoCacheControl
member.summary: An abstraction used to granularly control cache invalidation for the cache in the current tenant.
member.remarks:
Changes in the following areas must (and do) invalidate the cache, either directly (via call) or indirectly (by being included in the caching key):
Application Version (including ISV version)
Instance ID
Customizations (publish/unpublish)
Tenant ID
Installation Type (ERP or Portal)
Current Locale
Locales List
Localization
Enabled Features
Attribute Fields
User-Defined Fields (UDF)
Site Map / Portal Map
Generic Inquiries
User Reports (stored in DB)
RPX Reports (stored on file system)
ARM Reports
Dashboards
Pivot Tables
Import/Export Scenarios
Power BI Reports
Business Scenarios (Wizards)
ASPX pages
Automation Definitions
Workflow Configuration (indirectly: it can be changed either by customizations or by changes in App_Runtime folder, and these cases are already handled separately)
Snapshot Restoration

member.name: M:SerilogTimings.Extensions.SerilogTimingsExtensions.TimeOperationVerbose(Serilog.ILogger,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Begin a new timed operation leveled at . The return value must be disposed to complete the operation.
member.param: A log message describing the operation, in message template format.
Arguments to the log message. These will be stored and captured only when the operation completes, so do not pass arguments that are mutated during the operation.
